MaleText: Ah, The Gilded Rose... with its soft down beds and warm baths... just thinking about that Inn makes me want to... ::yawn:: Lucky you if you're heading over there...  you will find it in the west side of the Trade District.   ...nice soft pillows, warm blankets.  ::yawn::
FemaleText: Ah, The Gilded Rose... with its soft down beds and warm baths... just thinking about that Inn makes me want to... ::yawn:: Lucky you if you're heading over there...  you will find it in the west side of the Trade District.   ...nice soft pillows, warm blankets.  ::yawn::

MaleText: There is a mailbox located conveniently right between the Stormwind Bank and The Gilded Rose Inn in the Trade District.
FemaleText: There is a mailbox located conveniently right between the Stormwind Bank and The Gilded Rose Inn in the Trade District.

MaleText: I don't know how they do it...  those mailboxes must be magic portals or something.  Why I see people gathered around the mailbox next to the bank all day pulling swords and shields and various armor all from that small box!
FemaleText: I don't know how they do it...  those mailboxes must be magic portals or something.  Why I see people gathered around the mailbox next to the bank all day pulling swords and shields and various armor all from that small box!

Hi! I just got back from exploring the Ruins of Kel'Theril, to the southwest. Now I'm intent on investigating the Wildkin that lie just up the ridge here, in Owl Wing Thicket.$B$BHave you spoken to Erelas Ambersky in Rut'theran Village? He requested that I come here, and perhaps he has a task for you as well.
Have you seen Watcher Backus? So brave...$B$BI think he's the toughest of all the Night Watch. I wonder if he even notices I'm around....

MaleText: Thank you!  You freed me!
FemaleText: Thank you!  You freed me!

MaleText: Oh, thank you!  I have been trapped in this nightmare for so long...
FemaleText: Oh, thank you!  I have been trapped in this nightmare for so long...

MaleText: At last, my soul is free!
FemaleText: At last, my soul is free!

MaleText: Thank you!  The battle for Darrowshire doomed me, but you have set me free!
FemaleText: Thank you!  The battle for Darrowshire doomed me, but you have set me free!

MaleText: Ah!  Please, if you see a survivor of Darrowshire, tell them I am free!
FemaleText: Ah!  Please, if you see a survivor of Darrowshire, tell them I am free!

The Emerald Circle strives to heal the wounded land of Felwood. Although the land is named for the very thing that has corrupted it, we hope that one day we will be able to eradicate the corruption from this land.

Hello, $c. I am Jessir Moonbow. I have come from Darnassus seeking two friends who came looking for signs of the Shadow Council in Felwood.$B$BIt seems those vile creatures who claim responsibility for much of the orcish race's suffering seeks to regain some of its power.$B$BMy two friends went looking in Jaedenar to prove one way or the other what was happening.$B$BI expected them to be here when I arrived, but now they are days late.

MaleText: Zug zug, brave $c!  I have the finest bred wolf mounts for you to peruse.  You'll not find another animal with the level of endurance and survival instincts that the wolf has anywhere!  Please, inspect them for yourself.
FemaleText: Zug zug, brave $c!  I have the finest bred wolf mounts for you to peruse.  You'll not find another animal with the level of endurance and survival instincts that the wolf has anywhere!  Please, inspect them for yourself.

MaleText: And a good day to ya, brave $c.  I know ya be lookin' for a fine steed.  There's no finer steed than a raptor under your reigns, lemme tell you $g mon : sis;!  Take a look at the ones I got to offer - bred from the fiercest stock anywhere.
FemaleText: And a good day to ya, brave $c.  I know ya be lookin' for a fine steed.  There's no finer steed than a raptor under your reigns, lemme tell you $g mon : sis;!  Take a look at the ones I got to offer - bred from the fiercest stock anywhere.

MaleText: They hand the corpses to me, I toss them in the pit.
Greetings, $n. I am Myolor Sunderfury, keeper of the Great Forge.

Your skill in blacksmithing is exceptional, $n. The time has come to make a decision. There are two paths you may choose: The way of the weaponsmith or the art of the armorsmith.$B$BBe warned, when you have chosen to dedicate yourself to a path, there is no going back. The discipline each path requires leaves no room for hybrids.

FemaleText: The time has come, my $g brother : sister; in arms, to take back the night from the Scourge!
The time has come, my $g brother : sister; in arms, to take back the night from the Scourge!

MaleText: By the grace of Elune, I am pleased to offer you the finest steed found anywhere in Teldrassil, and perhaps the world - the nightsaber.  For years, the Sentinel Army has relied on the value of these companions.$B$BTake your time friend and examine each one to your satisfaction.  I am sure you will not be disappointed.
FemaleText: By the grace of Elune, I am pleased to offer you the finest steed found anywhere in Teldrassil, and perhaps the world - the nightsaber.  For years, the Sentinel Army has relied on the value of these companions.$B$BTake your time friend and examine each one to your satisfaction.  I am sure you will not be disappointed.

MaleText: Um... I think you're a little too big to ride a Mechano-strider there, $g mister : ma'am;.  You'd likely crush the finely tuned servo-balancers!
FemaleText: Um... I think you're a little too big to ride a Mechano-strider there, $g mister : ma'am;.  You'd likely crush the finely tuned servo-balancers!

MaleText: If you have come looking for the gift of fast and safe mobility, then you have arrived at your destination!  This year's model of the new Mechano-striders have recently arrived, and I am ready to show you all they have to offer!
FemaleText: If you have come looking for the gift of fast and safe mobility, then you have arrived at your destination!  This year's model of the new Mechano-striders have recently arrived, and I am ready to show you all they have to offer!

MaleText: When the work of a blacksmith reaches your level of expert craftsmanship, I present them with a choice.$B$BWhile you are not required to make a choice, it is recommended that you do - after all, do you want to be a neophyte forever? It is the artisan armorsmiths and weaponsmiths that supply our armies, win our wars and garner acclaim!$B$BBe warned, $n. Once a choice is made and the tasks required completed - there is no going back. One can only walk down one path.
I am Krathok, overseer of these craftsmen.
Greetings, $r.
Hail, $c!
What do you want?
Ya may not follow the ways of the Light like a Knight of the Silver Hand, but ya can always ask us for aid.
FemaleText: Ya may not follow the ways of the Light like a Knight of the Silver Hand, but ya can always ask us for aid.

MaleText: The Light be with ya, $c. How can I help ya?
FemaleText: The Light be with ya, $c. How can I help ya?

MaleText: A fierce wind is coming - I can tell by the ache in my exposed knee.  I just hope we don't get caught up in it.

Well now $n, let's get to work on those cauldrons!  If you're going to collect the components we need, then get a vitreous focuser from me.  You'll need to have it on you to identify the necessary resources found on the Scourge that will turn those cauldrons.$B$BYou'll also need a dose of arcane quickener for the cauldrons.  It's not cheap, nor is it stable.  Once you have it, you'll only have thirty minutes to use it before it expires on you; be smart about buying it.

Based on the sample of the toxin you provided for us, we think you will need the following: an arcane quickener, six osseous agitators, and four pieces of runecloth.  With the vitreous focuser in tow, acquire the agitators from skeletal undead here in the Plaguelands!$B$BOnce you have these items, you should be able to load the counter agent into that cauldron.

Based on the sample of the toxin you provided for us, we think you will need the following: an arcane quickener, five somatic intensifiers, and and four pieces of runecloth.  With the vitreous focuser in tow, acquire the intensifiers from zombie or ghoul undead here in the Plaguelands!$B$BOnce you have these items, you should be able to load the counter agent into that cauldron.

Based on the sample of the toxin you provided for us, we think you will need the following: an arcane quickener, four ectoplasmic resonators, and four pieces of runecloth.  With the vitreous focuser in tow, acquire the resonators from wraith and ghostly undead here in the Plaguelands!$B$BOnce you have these items, you should be able to load the counter agent into that cauldron.
This job is definitely not worth sixteen-five a year.

Well now $n, let's get to work on those cauldrons!  If you're going to collect the components we need, then get a vitreous focuser from me.  You'll need to have it on you to identify the necessary resources found on the Scourge that will turn those cauldrons.$B$BYou'll also need a dose of arcane quickener for the cauldrons.  It's not cheap, nor is it stable.  Once you have it, you'll only have thirty minutes to use it before it expires on you; be smart about buying it.

FemaleText: Shhh... do you smell something?

MaleText: The Scourge's plague still dominates the zone, and we have a long way to go before the plague will be altered enough to affect them.  Collect the necessary resources and help out the war effort!
FemaleText: The Scourge's plague still dominates the zone, and we have a long way to go before the plague will be altered enough to affect them.  Collect the necessary resources and help out the war effort!

MaleText: The Hunter Trainer's name is Thotar.  Seek him out inside the burrow on the southwest corner of Razor Hill.
FemaleText: The Hunter Trainer's name is Thotar.  Seek him out inside the burrow on the southwest corner of Razor Hill.

MaleText: You're a hunter?  Well anyway, you'll find Thotar hiding from the sun inside the burrow at the southwest corner of town.
FemaleText: You're a hunter?  Well anyway, you'll find Thotar hiding from the sun inside the burrow at the southwest corner of town.

MaleText: Speak with Un'Thuwa to the south in Sen'jin Village.
FemaleText: Speak with Un'Thuwa to the south in Sen'jin Village.

MaleText: That's troll business.  Look for Un'Thuwa in Sen'jin Village down south.
FemaleText: That's troll business.  Look for Un'Thuwa in Sen'jin Village down south.

MaleText: Find Kaplak on top of the burrow in the southwest section of town.
FemaleText: Find Kaplak on top of the burrow in the southwest section of town.

MaleText: Why would you want to talk to Kaplak?  Nevermind.  Look for him on top of the burrow in the southwest corner of Razor Hill.  Just make sure that you keep your hands in your own pockets!
FemaleText: Why would you want to talk to Kaplak?  Nevermind.  Look for him on top of the burrow in the southwest corner of Razor Hill.  Just make sure that you keep your hands in your own pockets!

MaleText: You need to find Swart.  Look for him inside the barracks on the east side of Razor Hill.
FemaleText: You need to find Swart.  Look for him inside the barracks on the east side of Razor Hill.

MaleText: The Warchief brings change that will bring the Horde victory!  Look for Swart inside the barracks on the east side of town.
FemaleText: The Warchief brings change that will bring the Horde victory!  Look for Swart inside the barracks on the east side of town.

MaleText: On the east side of Razor Hill, behind the barracks is where you will find Dhugru Gorelust.
FemaleText: On the east side of Razor Hill, behind the barracks is where you will find Dhugru Gorelust.

MaleText: Dhugru Gorelust is hiding behind the barracks on the east side of town.  Don't let me find out that you're in league with the Burning Legion!
FemaleText: Dhugru Gorelust is hiding behind the barracks on the east side of town.  Don't let me find out that you're in league with the Burning Legion!

MaleText: Look for Tarshaw Jaggedscar in the barracks on the east side of town.
FemaleText: Look for Tarshaw Jaggedscar in the barracks on the east side of town.

MaleText: Find Tarshaw Jaggedscar inside the barracks on the east side of Razor Hill.  Bring pride and honor to the Horde youngling!
FemaleText: Find Tarshaw Jaggedscar inside the barracks on the east side of Razor Hill.  Bring pride and honor to the Horde youngling!

MaleText: Head north up the road to Orgrimmar.  You can ask one of the grunts there for directions to the Cooking Trainer.
FemaleText: Head north up the road to Orgrimmar.  You can ask one of the grunts there for directions to the Cooking Trainer.

MaleText: Mmmmm food.  It's not too long of a run, but you need to head north to Orgrimmar and ask one of the grunts there.
FemaleText: Mmmmm food.  It's not too long of a run, but you need to head north to Orgrimmar and ask one of the grunts there.

MaleText: There's one in Orgrimmar.  A grunt up there will know what directions to give you.  Just head north up the road here, you can't miss it.
FemaleText: There's one in Orgrimmar.  A grunt up there will know what directions to give you.  Just head north up the road here, you can't miss it.

MaleText: I don't know of one of those around here.  Your best bet is to go to Orgrimmar to the north and speak to one of their grunts.
FemaleText: I don't know of one of those around here.  Your best bet is to go to Orgrimmar to the north and speak to one of their grunts.

MaleText: I've seen a troll named Lau'Tiki fishing down south at the Darkspear Strand.  That's just on the outskirts of Sen'jin Village.
FemaleText: I've seen a troll named Lau'Tiki fishing down south at the Darkspear Strand.  That's just on the outskirts of Sen'jin Village.

MaleText: You're looking for Lau'Tiki.  You'll find him on Darkspear Strand out beyond Sen'jin Village to the south.
FemaleText: You're looking for Lau'Tiki.  You'll find him on Darkspear Strand out beyond Sen'jin Village to the south.

MaleText: You'll need to head to Orgrimmar for that.  Just follow the road heading out of Razor Hill to the north through the canyon and you'll come to it.  When you get there ask one of their grunts for further directions.
FemaleText: You'll need to head to Orgrimmar for that.  Just follow the road heading out of Razor Hill to the north through the canyon and you'll come to it.  When you get there ask one of their grunts for further directions.

MaleText: To learn to cure leather and work with hides go to Orgrimmar to the north.  One of the Orgrimmar Grunts will be able to tell you the way to the Leatherworking Trainer.
FemaleText: To learn to cure leather and work with hides go to Orgrimmar to the north.  One of the Orgrimmar Grunts will be able to tell you the way to the Leatherworking Trainer.

MaleText: Sure, sure.  We have a Mining Trainer right here in town.  Look for Krunn over in the northwest corner alongside the inn.
FemaleText: Sure, sure.  We have a Mining Trainer right here in town.  Look for Krunn over in the northwest corner alongside the inn.

MaleText: Plenty of good mining to be had in Durotar, or so I hear.  So good in fact that we have a Mining Trainer right here in Razor Hill.  You'll find Krunn next to the heated forge in the northwest corner of town.
FemaleText: Plenty of good mining to be had in Durotar, or so I hear.  So good in fact that we have a Mining Trainer right here in Razor Hill.  You'll find Krunn next to the heated forge in the northwest corner of town.

MaleText: There's a Skinning Trainer in Orgrimmar.  To get there head north up the road out of Razor Hill.  Ask an Orgrimmar Grunt for directions when you arrive.
FemaleText: There's a Skinning Trainer in Orgrimmar.  To get there head north up the road out of Razor Hill.  Ask an Orgrimmar Grunt for directions when you arrive.

MaleText: There's one in Orgrimmar.  Go north and talk to one of their grunts.
FemaleText: There's one in Orgrimmar.  Go north and talk to one of their grunts.

MaleText: Then Orgrimmar is where you need to go.  The north road out of Razor Hill leads directly there.  Just talk to one of the grunts there and they can give you further directions.
FemaleText: Then Orgrimmar is where you need to go.  The north road out of Razor Hill leads directly there.  Just talk to one of the grunts there and they can give you further directions.

MaleText: You can learn to sew up in Orgrimmar.  That's to the north.  Maybe one of the Orgrimmar Grunts can help you.
FemaleText: You can learn to sew up in Orgrimmar.  That's to the north.  Maybe one of the Orgrimmar Grunts can help you.

MaleText: You'll find the Wind Rider Master in Orgrimmar.  Go north up the road to get there and ask an Orgrimmar Grunt for further directions.
FemaleText: You'll find the Wind Rider Master in Orgrimmar.  Go north up the road to get there and ask an Orgrimmar Grunt for further directions.

MaleText: Can't you see I'm busy here?  Go north up the road to Orgrimmar and ask one of the grunts there.  You can't miss it.
FemaleText: Can't you see I'm busy here?  Go north up the road to Orgrimmar and ask one of the grunts there.  You can't miss it.

MaleText: Which trainer do you seek?
FemaleText: Which trainer do you seek?

MaleText: Which profession?
FemaleText: Which profession?

MaleText: What are you looking for?
FemaleText: What are you looking for?

With the cauldrons breeched, we are now able to introduce the counter agent into the environment.  This should give the scourge a taste of their own medicine, as it were!$B$BCheck with Alchemist Arbington on information regarding the reagents needed to use in the cauldrons.  I will be handling all information reports on how we are doing overall in turning the plague against the Scourge!

With the cauldrons breeched, we are now able to introduce the counter agent into the environment.  This should give the scourge a taste of their own medicine, as it were!$B$BCheck with Apothecary Dithers on information regarding the reagents needed to use in the cauldrons.  I will be handling all information reports on how we are doing overall in turning the plague against the Scourge!
Hello young $g Master:Mistress;. I am Eva Sarkhoff and this is my husband, Lucien. It is a pleasure to make your acquaintance.

Certainly, $g sir:miss;. We were once servants of the house Barov: What is now known as the Scholomance.$B$BI was the head maid and Lucien was Master Barov's butler.$B$BWe had worked for the Barovs for decades, until...$B$B<Eva weeps.>

Oh it's just so horrible, $g sir:miss;. The house Barov was once full of life... full of splendor. The manor was the Barov's primary residence amidst their far reaching empire.$B$BLucien and I noticed that as the days progressed, the Barovs became depressed. Despondent. Paranoia and rage often overcame the master and missus. At night, we could hear the Barovs arguing in their chambers. From what we understood, their greed had 'broken the dam,' so to speak.

We suspect that in order to preserve their fortune and hold of the land - well past their lifespan - the Barovs made a deal with a powerful human mage named Kel'Thuzad.$B$B<Eva shudders.>$B$BFrom this deal sprang the school of necromancy: A place which bore the Cult of the Damned and would become their capital.$B$BAs each week passed, the house Barov became more and more decrepit...$B$BDark beings began to take residence in the various wings of the house. Upkeep became impossible... and disgusting.

And go where? It was all that we knew; all that we had known and all that we would ever know.$B$BEventually, we lost contact with the Barovs and ultimately, were separated from the household. We knew not what happened to the other servants, only that there were screams. Tortured screams.$B$BKnowing that we had nowhere to go, Lucien and I were forced to hide in our quarters. During the day, when the school was relatively quiet, Lucien would sneak out to scrounge up food and drink.

We did this for about six months and watched as the house went through horrifying changes. Foul monsters roamed through the manor at will. Dark cultists populated every inch with various paraphernalia relating to rituals and sacrifices. We knew that we could not hide much longer.$B$BAs expected, we were found and captured. They stripped us of all our clothes and laid us out inside a circle of blood. We sat there for days, naked and terrified.

Restraints? There are things in this world far more restraining than bars and shackles, young $g master:mistress;. The undead surrounded us, constantly tormenting us with horrifying acts of depravity.$B$BFinally, he came. He introduced himself as Doctor Theolen Krastinov. We came to know him as 'The Butcher.'~

We finally understood what the screams were from. The Butcher exposed us to pain that we did not know existed. He used us in countless experiments, attempting to devise a plague.$B$BThe days turned to weeks. We would have died on the first day had it not been for that cruel bastard keeping us alive through magical means.

The Butcher would speak of 'the blood of innocents,' and his dark master, 'Kirtonos.' Of how he must appease his master.$B$BFinally, the beast was done with his experiments. We had been drained of all life. Our spirits shattered. The sweet embrace of death was upon us and we welcomed it with open arms. But in his infinite cruelty, the Butcher revived us from death's door.$B$BWe were to be kept alive and thrown to his ravenous ghouls. He laughed as he watched the fiends devour our flesh.
We feel nothing. Our souls remain here, in limbo. We are unable to leave until our remains are found and spirits laid to rest.

MaleText: It is Gennia Runetotem's counsel that you seek.  You will find her in the large tent on the east side of the village.
FemaleText: It is Gennia Runetotem's counsel that you seek.  You will find her in the large tent on the east side of the village.

MaleText: The way of the Druid is sibling to the Shaman.  Gennia Runetotem is steeped in such knowledge.  Seek her out in the large tent on the east side of Bloodhoof Village.
FemaleText: The way of the Druid is sibling to the Shaman.  Gennia Runetotem is steeped in such knowledge.  Seek her out in the large tent on the east side of Bloodhoof Village.

MaleText: Yaw Sharpmane awaits you on the north edge of the village.  He can teach you the ways of the Hunter.
FemaleText: Yaw Sharpmane awaits you on the north edge of the village.  He can teach you the ways of the Hunter.

MaleText: To learn to be one with Nature in the eyes of the Earth Mother, this is a matter of pride.  If your will is to learn the ways of the Hunter you must seek out Yaw Sharpmane at the north end of Bloodhoof Village.
FemaleText: To learn to be one with Nature in the eyes of the Earth Mother, this is a matter of pride.  If your will is to learn the ways of the Hunter you must seek out Yaw Sharpmane at the north end of Bloodhoof Village.

MaleText: Krang Stonehoof stands astride his training circle at the southeast corner of the village.
FemaleText: Krang Stonehoof stands astride his training circle at the southeast corner of the village.

MaleText: If it is the way of the Warrior that you crave then you must seek out Krang Stonehoof.  You will find him in the southeast corner of the village at his training circle, often instructing his other students.
FemaleText: If it is the way of the Warrior that you crave then you must seek out Krang Stonehoof.  You will find him in the southeast corner of the village at his training circle, often instructing his other students.

MaleText: While we have no Alchemy Trainer here in Bloodhoof Village, there is one in Thunder Bluff to the north.  Follow the road there and ask one of the Bluffwatchers for directions when you get to the top.
FemaleText: While we have no Alchemy Trainer here in Bloodhoof Village, there is one in Thunder Bluff to the north.  Follow the road there and ask one of the Bluffwatchers for directions when you get to the top.

MaleText: Using the fruits of the Earth Mother to create potions to aid us in our eternal struggle is an honorable endeavor.  To learn of this you must travel north to our great home of Thunder Bluff.  When you arrive at the top seek out the assistance of one of the Bluffwatchers for more specific directions.
FemaleText: Using the fruits of the Earth Mother to create potions to aid us in our eternal struggle is an honorable endeavor.  To learn of this you must travel north to our great home of Thunder Bluff.  When you arrive at the top seek out the assistance of one of the Bluffwatchers for more specific directions.

MaleText: There is a Blacksmithing Trainer in our great home Thunder Bluff to the north.  If you seek such knowledge then head there and ask one of the Bluffwatchers for directions.
FemaleText: There is a Blacksmithing Trainer in our great home Thunder Bluff to the north.  If you seek such knowledge then head there and ask one of the Bluffwatchers for directions.

MaleText: You desire to shape the bones of the Earth Mother into tools that will aid the Horde.  Good, good.  Follow the path north out of Bloodhoof Village until you come to the elevator leading to the top of Thunder Bluff.  A Bluffwatcher there can give you further assistance.
FemaleText: You desire to shape the bones of the Earth Mother into tools that will aid the Horde.  Good, good.  Follow the path north out of Bloodhoof Village until you come to the elevator leading to the top of Thunder Bluff.  A Bluffwatcher there can give you further assistance.

MaleText: Away to Thunder Bluff to the north is where your journey takes you then friend.  Once there seek out the wisdom of one of the Bluffwatchers who can tell you directly where to find whom you seek.
FemaleText: Away to Thunder Bluff to the north is where your journey takes you then friend.  Once there seek out the wisdom of one of the Bluffwatchers who can tell you directly where to find whom you seek.

MaleText: Such wisdom is steeped in a mystery that can only be found in great Thunder Bluff.  Follow the path north out of Bloodhoof Village until you come to an elevator at the base of the bluffs.  Ride it to the top and ask one of the Bluffwatchers for further assistance.
FemaleText: Such wisdom is steeped in a mystery that can only be found in great Thunder Bluff.  Follow the path north out of Bloodhoof Village until you come to an elevator at the base of the bluffs.  Ride it to the top and ask one of the Bluffwatchers for further assistance.

MaleText: You are looking for Uthan Stillwater.  You will find him west of the village, fishing at Stonebull Lake.
FemaleText: You are looking for Uthan Stillwater.  You will find him west of the village, fishing at Stonebull Lake.

MaleText: Give a bull a fish and feed him for a day.  Teach a bull to fish and feed him for life.  Uthan Stillwater can teach you how to fish.  Seek his wisdom west of Bloodhoof Village along the banks of Stonebull Lake.
FemaleText: Give a bull a fish and feed him for a day.  Teach a bull to fish and feed him for life.  Uthan Stillwater can teach you how to fish.  Seek his wisdom west of Bloodhoof Village along the banks of Stonebull Lake.

MaleText: If you desire to learn the ways of Herbalism then it is to Thunder Bluff that you must go.  Follow the road north out of Bloodhoof Village and take the elevator to the top of the rise.  You can ask a Bluffwatcher there for further assistance.
FemaleText: If you desire to learn the ways of Herbalism then it is to Thunder Bluff that you must go.  Follow the road north out of Bloodhoof Village and take the elevator to the top of the rise.  You can ask a Bluffwatcher there for further assistance.

MaleText: There are those that would teach you of Herbalism in the great home of Thunder Bluff away to the north.  Follow the road out of the village to get there and at the base of the bluff ride the elevator to the top of the rise.  There are many Bluffwatchers there who can direct you further.
FemaleText: There are those that would teach you of Herbalism in the great home of Thunder Bluff away to the north.  Follow the road out of the village to get there and at the base of the bluff ride the elevator to the top of the rise.  There are many Bluffwatchers there who can direct you further.

MaleText: Hmmm, I think you will need to go up to Thunder Bluff to learn that.  Head north on the road out of Bloodhoof Village.  It will take you to the base of Thunder Bluff.  Ride the elevator to the top and you should be able to ask any of the Bluffwatchers there for further assistance.
FemaleText: Hmmm, I think you will need to go up to Thunder Bluff to learn that.  Head north on the road out of Bloodhoof Village.  It will take you to the base of Thunder Bluff.  Ride the elevator to the top and you should be able to ask any of the Bluffwatchers there for further assistance.

MaleText: I hear that they have a Mining Trainer in Thunder Bluff to the north.  Take the road out of the village and when you get there ride the elevator to the top of the rise.  Any of the Bluffwatchers should be able to help you from there.
FemaleText: I hear that they have a Mining Trainer in Thunder Bluff to the north.  Take the road out of the village and when you get there ride the elevator to the top of the rise.  Any of the Bluffwatchers should be able to help you from there.

MaleText: Which trainer do you seek?
FemaleText: Which trainer do you seek?

MaleText: Which profession?
FemaleText: Which profession?

MaleText: What are you looking for?
FemaleText: What are you looking for?

MaleText: We don't have a bank here in Brill, you'll have to go to the Undercity for that.  At the back of the Ruins of Lordaeron to the south are elevators that will take you down into the Undercity.  Once there ask one of the Undercity Guardians for more precise directions.
FemaleText: We don't have a bank here in Brill, you'll have to go to the Undercity for that.  At the back of the Ruins of Lordaeron to the south are elevators that will take you down into the Undercity.  Once there ask one of the Undercity Guardians for more precise directions.

MaleText: What could you possibly need a bank for?  Very well, you'll need to go through the Ruins of Lordaeron to the south of Brill.  In the back are a set of elevators leading down into the Undercity.  When you get there stop any of those lumbering Abominations they like to call an Undercity Guardian and ask it for better directions.
FemaleText: What could you possibly need a bank for?  Very well, you'll need to go through the Ruins of Lordaeron to the south of Brill.  In the back are a set of elevators leading down into the Undercity.  When you get there stop any of those lumbering Abominations they like to call an Undercity Guardian and ask it for better directions.

MaleText: There's a Bat Handler inside the Undercity.  Head south down the road out of Brill, then west at the T-intersection.  The Ruins of Lordaeron will be on your left.  Go into them and then down into the Undercity.  You can ask an Undercity Guardian there for further assistance.
FemaleText: There's a Bat Handler inside the Undercity.  Head south down the road out of Brill, then west at the T-intersection.  The Ruins of Lordaeron will be on your left.  Go into them and then down into the Undercity.  You can ask an Undercity Guardian there for further assistance.

MaleText: Somewhere to fly to?  You'll need to go to the Undercity for that!  Go south on the road out of town, then southwest to the Ruins of Lordaeron.  You can catch the elevator down to the Undercity from the back of the ruins and once there ask an Undercity Guardian for more specific directions.
FemaleText: Somewhere to fly to?  You'll need to go to the Undercity for that!  Go south on the road out of town, then southwest to the Ruins of Lordaeron.  You can catch the elevator down to the Undercity from the back of the ruins and once there ask an Undercity Guardian for more specific directions.

MaleText: You'll find Innkeeper Renee inside the Gallows' End Tavern at the southeast end of the street running through town.
FemaleText: You'll find Innkeeper Renee inside the Gallows' End Tavern at the southeast end of the street running through town.

MaleText: Now if I were Innkeeper Renee where might I be?  Hmmm?  Oh, perhaps inside the Gallows' End Tavern.  Yes, that's it, I'm sure of it.  Try the southeast end of Brill... think you can find that?
FemaleText: Now if I were Innkeeper Renee where might I be?  Hmmm?  Oh, perhaps inside the Gallows' End Tavern.  Yes, that's it, I'm sure of it.  Try the southeast end of Brill... think you can find that?

MaleText: You'll find the Mage Trainer, Cain Firesong, upstairs on the landing at the Gallows' End Tavern, which is on the southeast end of Brill.  I guess he checked in too late to get a room.
FemaleText: You'll find the Mage Trainer, Cain Firesong, upstairs on the landing at the Gallows' End Tavern, which is on the southeast end of Brill.  I guess he checked in too late to get a room.

MaleText: Do I look to you like I cast spells?  Well, I did hear that Cain Firesong was hanging out on the upstairs landing of the Gallows' End Tavern at the southeast end of town.  Odd how he just stands there outside of Gretchen's room like that.
FemaleText: Do I look to you like I cast spells?  Well, I did hear that Cain Firesong was hanging out on the upstairs landing of the Gallows' End Tavern at the southeast end of town.  Odd how he just stands there outside of Gretchen's room like that.

MaleText: The Rogue Trainer's name is Marion Call.  You can find her upstairs in the reading room at the Gallows' End Tavern at the town's southeast edge.
FemaleText: The Rogue Trainer's name is Marion Call.  You can find her upstairs in the reading room at the Gallows' End Tavern at the town's southeast edge.

MaleText: Marion Call is keeping Dark Cleric Beryl company in the reading room upstairs at the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast edge of Brill.  I'm just dying to see who wins that staring contest.
FemaleText: Marion Call is keeping Dark Cleric Beryl company in the reading room upstairs at the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast edge of Brill.  I'm just dying to see who wins that staring contest.

MaleText: Rupert Boch is his name.  I hear that he's upstairs in one of the rooms at the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast end of town.
FemaleText: Rupert Boch is his name.  I hear that he's upstairs in one of the rooms at the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast end of town.

MaleText: That's Rupert Boch you're looking for.  He and his entourage have a room upstairs at the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast end of Brill.
FemaleText: That's Rupert Boch you're looking for.  He and his entourage have a room upstairs at the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast end of Brill.

MaleText: Fancy yourself a chef?  Head to the Undercity south of town for your training.  You can catch the elevators heading down at the back of the Ruins of Lordaeron.  Talk to one of those lumbering Undercity Guardians for further assistance once you arrive.
FemaleText: Fancy yourself a chef?  Head to the Undercity south of town for your training.  You can catch the elevators heading down at the back of the Ruins of Lordaeron.  Talk to one of those lumbering Undercity Guardians for further assistance once you arrive.

MaleText: Why cook when everything tastes like ashes in your mouth?  If you have one still that is.  Very well, head to the Undercity south of Brill and ask an Undercity Guardian there for further directions to their Cooking Trainer.  To get there you can take the elevators down from the rear of the Ruins of Lordaeron.
FemaleText: Why cook when everything tastes like ashes in your mouth?  If you have one still that is.  Very well, head to the Undercity south of Brill and ask an Undercity Guardian there for further directions to their Cooking Trainer.  To get there you can take the elevators down from the rear of the Ruins of Lordaeron.

MaleText: You can find Vance Undergloom upstairs in a room at the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast side of Brill.
FemaleText: You can find Vance Undergloom upstairs in a room at the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast side of Brill.

MaleText: Word is that Vance Undergloom has taken a permanent room upstairs at the Gallows' End Tavern at the southeast end of town.  I think he's just off the reading room.
FemaleText: Word is that Vance Undergloom has taken a permanent room upstairs at the Gallows' End Tavern at the southeast end of town.  I think he's just off the reading room.

MaleText: While there's no Engineering Trainer in Brill, there is one down in the Undercity.  To get there head to the back of the Ruins of Lordaeron to the south of town and take the elevator down.  Once you get there ask an Undercity Guardian for more specific directions.
FemaleText: While there's no Engineering Trainer in Brill, there is one down in the Undercity.  To get there head to the back of the Ruins of Lordaeron to the south of town and take the elevator down.  Once you get there ask an Undercity Guardian for more specific directions.

MaleText: Rifles, dynamite, bombs, exploding sheep... what's not to love?  To learn how to make these and many other exciting tools of the trade head to the Undercity, under the Ruins of Lordaeron to the south of Brill.  Take the elevators down at the back of the ruins.  Once you arrive speak to one of the Undercity Guardians about where the trainer is exactly.
FemaleText: Rifles, dynamite, bombs, exploding sheep... what's not to love?  To learn how to make these and many other exciting tools of the trade head to the Undercity, under the Ruins of Lordaeron to the south of Brill.  Take the elevators down at the back of the ruins.  Once you arrive speak to one of the Undercity Guardians about where the trainer is exactly.

MaleText: Nurse Neela greets all of her future customers as they enter the Gallows' End Tavern at the southeast end of town.
FemaleText: Nurse Neela greets all of her future customers as they enter the Gallows' End Tavern at the southeast end of town.

MaleText: Butcher you say?  Oh, First Aid Trainer!  Same thing.  When you see Nurse Neela standing just inside the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast side of town you'll know why.
FemaleText: Butcher you say?  Oh, First Aid Trainer!  Same thing.  When you see Nurse Neela standing just inside the Gallows' End Tavern on the southeast side of town you'll know why.

MaleText: Look for Faruza.  Last I saw she was standing out front between the stables and the house on the northwest end of town.
FemaleText: Look for Faruza.  Last I saw she was standing out front between the stables and the house on the northwest end of town.

MaleText: Actually I prefer traditional medicines... leeches, maggots, bonesaws... that sort of thing.  Well to each their own.  You can find the our local Herbalism Trainer, Faruza, standing out front near the stables in Brill.
FemaleText: Actually I prefer traditional medicines... leeches, maggots, bonesaws... that sort of thing.  Well to each their own.  You can find the our local Herbalism Trainer, Faruza, standing out front near the stables in Brill.

MaleText: That would be Shelene Rhobart.  Take the road southeast out of Brill then head east at the intersection.  She's at a camp along the side of the road.
FemaleText: That would be Shelene Rhobart.  Take the road southeast out of Brill then head east at the intersection.  She's at a camp along the side of the road.

MaleText: Nothing quite like the feel of something dead rubbing up against you.  You can find Shelene Rhobart by heading southeast on the road out of town, and then going east at the intersection.  She's at a small camp there not too far along the road.
FemaleText: Nothing quite like the feel of something dead rubbing up against you.  You can find Shelene Rhobart by heading southeast on the road out of town, and then going east at the intersection.  She's at a small camp there not too far along the road.

MaleText: I hear that they have a Mining Trainer in the Undercity.  All you have to do to get there is head south out of town and go to the back of the Ruins of Lordaeron.  Then take the elevator down into the Undercity itself and ask an Undercity Guardian for further directions.
FemaleText: I hear that they have a Mining Trainer in the Undercity.  All you have to do to get there is head south out of town and go to the back of the Ruins of Lordaeron.  Then take the elevator down into the Undercity itself and ask an Undercity Guardian for further directions.

MaleText: I guess your first exercise is going to be to mine your way down to the Undercity.  Heh, get it?  Mine... nevermind.  To get to the Undercity go to the rear of the Ruins of Lordaeron south of Brill, and take the elevator down.  Ask one of the Undercity Guardians there for further assistance.
FemaleText: I guess your first exercise is going to be to mine your way down to the Undercity.  Heh, get it?  Mine... nevermind.  To get to the Undercity go to the rear of the Ruins of Lordaeron south of Brill, and take the elevator down.  Ask one of the Undercity Guardians there for further assistance.

MaleText: Rand Rhobart is fairly good at skinning felbats and the like.  You can find him at a camp along the road to the southeast of Brill.  Take the road southeast out of town and then head east at the intersection.
FemaleText: Rand Rhobart is fairly good at skinning felbats and the like.  You can find him at a camp along the road to the southeast of Brill.  Take the road southeast out of town and then head east at the intersection.

MaleText: You aiming to be a taxidermist?  I don't like people who think they can stuff and mount me because they think I'm dead.  No?  Good!  Look for Rand Rhobart at a camp to the southeast of town.  To get to him take the road southeast out of Brill and hang a left at the intersection.
FemaleText: You aiming to be a taxidermist?  I don't like people who think they can stuff and mount me because they think I'm dead.  No?  Good!  Look for Rand Rhobart at a camp to the southeast of town.  To get to him take the road southeast out of Brill and hang a left at the intersection.

MaleText: It is Bowen Brisboise that you seek then.  You'll find him inside his house southwest of Brill just on the other side of the bridge at Cold Hearth Manor.
FemaleText: It is Bowen Brisboise that you seek then.  You'll find him inside his house southwest of Brill just on the other side of the bridge at Cold Hearth Manor.

MaleText: Black, grey and dark purple are the prescribed colors.  See to it that you don't stray onto the wrong side of fashion street friend.  Bowen Brisboise can help to see that you don't.  You'll find him inside Cold Hearth Manor on the other side of the bridge to the southwest of town.
FemaleText: Black, grey and dark purple are the prescribed colors.  See to it that you don't stray onto the wrong side of fashion street friend.  Bowen Brisboise can help to see that you don't.  You'll find him inside Cold Hearth Manor on the other side of the bridge to the southwest of town.

MaleText: Which trainer do you seek?
FemaleText: Which trainer do you seek?

MaleText: Which profession?
FemaleText: Which profession?

MaleText: What are you looking for?
FemaleText: What are you looking for?

So cold... and hungry.$B$BMy poor friend, I hope you've found peace. I can't stand to think about what they could have done to you.$B$BYou! You there! Please, you have to help me escape. One of them has a key, can you find it? I know they have it. If you get it, you can help me get out of here. Trey is probably already dead, but there's still time! Please, can you help me?

You've already done me a great service, $n. For that I thank you.$B$BThe least I can do now is tell you what brought me here: My long time friend Trey Lightforge and I came to Jaedenar to investigate the Shadow Council when they caught us unprepared. They took Trey deeper into Shadow Hold and put me in here after taking all of our equipment... I can still hear his screams from below, $n. They were... inhuman. I don't know what they've done to him, but they will pay for it.
As you inspect the cage and the Night elf inside, you get an odd sense of deja vu. For some reason she does not make eye contact with you--it is almost as if you are not there to her.

MaleText: Can't you see we're trying to prepare for Uther's visit? Now get out of my way, I have much work to do!
FemaleText: Can't you see we're trying to prepare for Uther's visit? Now get out of my way, I have much work to do!

MaleText: Have you tried our bread? Baker Masterson must be the most gifted chef to have ever lived!
FemaleText: Have you tried our bread? Baker Masterson must be the most gifted chef to have ever lived!

MaleText: Welcome to Caer Darrow, stranger.
FemaleText: Welcome to Caer Darrow, stranger.

MaleText: We're not really rude people, stranger, it's just that everyone is in a rush, trying to make sure that everything is perfect for Uther's arrival. It's not often that the Lightbringer comes to town.
FemaleText: We're not really rude people, stranger, it's just that everyone is in a rush, trying to make sure that everything is perfect for Uther's arrival. It's not often that the Lightbringer comes to town.

MaleText: Another lovely day on our beautiful island.
FemaleText: Another lovely day on our beautiful island.

MaleText: Watch your step, stranger. We do not allow miscreants in our town.
FemaleText: Watch your step, stranger. We do not allow miscreants in our town.

MaleText: I've got my eye on you, $r.
FemaleText: I've got my eye on you, $r.

MaleText: I have a lot of pent up anger and hostility. Just give me a reason, guttersnipe.
FemaleText: I have a lot of pent up anger and hostility. Just give me a reason, guttersnipe.

MaleText: Why, you look like a common street urchin!
FemaleText: Why, you look like a common street urchin!

MaleText: There's no loitering, pan handling, cursing, fighting, or anything else you're thinking about doing, allowed in Caer Darrow.
FemaleText: There's no loitering, pan handling, cursing, fighting, or anything else you're thinking about doing, allowed in Caer Darrow.

MaleText: The Cult of the Damned has grown large in scope. Nearly every city, from the capitals to the small hamlets and hovels of both the Horde and Alliance, have Cult members hidden amongst their citizenry.$B$BDo not look so surprised. The Cult only wears a uniform for ritual and ceremony. It is quite possible that you have interacted with one during your adventures and not even known.

Is it? This has always been their method of operation. What is of greater value to Kel'Thuzad and the ever growing Scourge army? A zealous, living, follower that can work their way into a society and then unleash a plague, destroying thousands; or a single undead trooper? Certainly you cannot be that dense$B$BYes, $r, they live, work, and plot among you.

Stop - no. Slow down - maybe.$B$BThe Scholomance is their primary source of training and education. It is from there that the Cult members fan out and ultimately, make their way into our societies.$B$BThat is why we must strike at the source. The very heart of the Cult of the Damned!

Slow down, $r. The one you need to kill is already dead. Killing him again will serve no purpose. There are very few ways in which a lich can actually be destroyed and none of those means are available to you or I. That is why I have a plan. A plan that will have a very noticeable and real impact upon the Cult.
It's simple, really. Rob the lich, Ras Frostwhisper, of his powers. Return him to his mortal form and then slay him, once and for all.

Ah, I suppose that I am getting ahead of myself. Ras Frostwhisper is the overseer of this school. The being responsible for training all of its Dark Masters. A lieutenant and favored pupil of Kel'Thuzad. He was once a hedge mage of Stromgarde: A rogue wizard that never received his formal training from Dalaran.$B$BWhen Kel'Thuzad opened the Cult, Ras was among the first to join his ranks. Ras knew that through dark magic, he would find immortality.
And find it he did. After quickly advancing through the ranks of the Cult, the Lich King himself granted Ras immortality. Thus was born Ras Frostwhisper, the lich.$B$BNow do you understand?
Good. In order to carry out my plan, we must first create a lifestone. Are you prepared to act?
Some were spared the anguish that memories provide.
The Barov house sure does keep me busy. Always some sort of refuse coming out of there.
My job title is Waste Management Specialist.
Perhaps you should speak into these sound enhancing devices attached to my FISTS OF FURY.
Ah, my sweet Brandy, I miss her so!

Well met, friend.  I am Officer Garush, and I am a proud member of a world-wide organization known as the Argent Dawn.  Our cause is to fight swiftly and mercilessly against any element of evil that surfaces in Azeroth.  We are not a political body, nor do we ever wish to become one.  Our cause is singular, and to that end we call both the Horde and Alliance as friends - friends in the cause of stamping out evil!$B$BFor the Dawn, my $g brother : sister;!

FemaleText: Well met, friend.  I am Officer Pureheart, and I am a proud member of a world-wide organization known as the Argent Dawn.  Our cause is simple - fight swifty and mercilessly against any element of evil that surfaces in Azeroth.  We are not a political body, nor do we ever wish to become one.  To that end we call both the Alliance and the Horde both as friends - friends in the cause of stamping out evil!$B$BFor the Dawn, my $g brother : sister;!

The Argent Dawn salutes you, $c.  I am Hasana - one of but a few authorized equipment and materiel quartermasters for the Dawn.$B$BAs you fight evil under our commission - all the while earning our respect and trust - you'll earn valor tokens from Officer Garush.  Tokens serve two purposes: use them to gain increased standing within our ranks, or use them as tender in acquiring special items.$B$BAs you improve your standing with the Dawn, you'll discover that more items will be made available to you.
Join the fight against evil!  Accept a commission within the Argent Dawn today!

MaleText: The Argent Dawn salutes you, $c!  The name's Lightspark, and I'm an authorized equipment and materiel quartermaster for the Dawn.$B$BAs you fight evil under our commission - all the while earning our respect and trust - you'll earn valor tokens from Officer Pureheart.  Tokens serve two purposes: use them to gain increased standing within our ranks, or use them as tender in acquiring special items.$B$BAs you improve your standing with the Dawn, you'll discover that more items will be made available to you.
Join the fight against evil!  Accept a commission within the Argent Dawn today!

FemaleText: Greetings, $c.  I am Miranda Breechlock - one of but a few authorized equipment and materiel quartermasters for the Dawn.$B$BAs you fight evil under our commission - all the while earning our respect and trust - you'll earn valor tokens from Duke Zverenhoff.  Tokens serve two purposes: use them to gain increased standing within our ranks, or use them as tender in acquiring special items.$B$BAs you improve your standing with the Dawn, you'll discover that more items will be made available to you.

MaleText: Greetings, $c.$B$BThose Sentinels over there have allowed me to share their camp as long as I promise no trouble will follow--I am sure you can appreciate the need for diplomacy while here, yes?$B$BI am here investigating disturbances to the land, and since it aids their cause also, they have agreed that my presence here could only aid the tenuous alliance between all of Azeroth's races. If you wish to aid me, then I would appreciate it, but regardless, please try not to cause any trouble.
Welcome to Steelgrill's Depot!

Race does not dictate honor, $r. While you remain on my farmstead, I ask that you remember and respect this credo.$B$BI have known orcs who have been as honorable as the most noble of knights and humans who have been as vile as the most ruthless of Scourge.$B$BBut I shall not bore you with tales of my youth! There is much work to be done - if that is what you desire.
What are you looking for?
FemaleText: What are you looking for?

MaleText: A bank?  Well, the closest bank around here is The Stormwind Counting House.  It's just up the road in Stormwind not far from the gates.
FemaleText: A bank?  Well, the closest bank around here is The Stormwind Counting House.  It's just up the road in Stormwind not far from the gates.

MaleText: Oh, you must mean the Stormwind Counting House.  It's not far from the gates after you enter Stormwind.
FemaleText: Oh, you must mean the Stormwind Counting House.  It's not far from the gates after you enter Stormwind.

MaleText: There are quite a few trainers available in Elwynn.  Which one are you looking for?
FemaleText: There are quite a few trainers available in Elwynn.  Which one are you looking for?

MaleText: I've heard that there's a dwarf in Stormwind who has achieved some fame for his hunting skill.  Maybe you should go see if he could help you.
FemaleText: I've heard that there's a dwarf in Stormwind who has achieved some fame for his hunting skill.  Maybe you should go see if he could help you.

MaleText: Josetta has been a blessing to this town with her aid of the local guards.  If you seek her for training in the ways of a priest, you can find her in the Lion's Pride Inn.
FemaleText: Josetta has been a blessing to this town with her aid of the local guards.  If you seek her for training in the ways of a priest, you can find her in the Lion's Pride Inn.

MaleText: I bet Josetta would be more than happy to teach you some new spells.  She is probably up in her room at the Lion's Pride Inn.
FemaleText: I bet Josetta would be more than happy to teach you some new spells.  She is probably up in her room at the Lion's Pride Inn.

MaleText: A rogue?  Hmmm... well, I've heard that Keryn Sylvius hangs around those shady types.  You might want to talk to her and see what you can learn.
FemaleText: A rogue?  Hmmm... well, I've heard that Keryn Sylvius hangs around those shady types.  You might want to talk to her and see what you can learn.

MaleText: I'd wager Keryn Sylvius knows the type you're looking for. The company Keryn keeps is less than honorable. She usually hangs out in the Lion's Pride Inn.
FemaleText: I'd wager Keryn Sylvius knows the type you're looking for. The company Keryn keeps is less than honorable. She usually hangs out in the Lion's Pride Inn.

MaleText: I know of a few people around here that practice a profession or two.  What profession do you have in mind?
FemaleText: I know of a few people around here that practice a profession or two.  What profession do you have in mind?

MaleText: That hermit Mallory is known to concoct some potions for the local townsfolk on occasion.  He has a cottage in the hills between Stormwind and Northshire.
FemaleText: That hermit Mallory is known to concoct some potions for the local townsfolk on occasion.  He has a cottage in the hills between Stormwind and Northshire.

MaleText: There is an alchemist that lives up in the hills between Northshire and Stormwind that might be of some help.  Why don't you go pay him a visit?
FemaleText: There is an alchemist that lives up in the hills between Northshire and Stormwind that might be of some help.  Why don't you go pay him a visit?

MaleText: Tomas may not be the best cook around, but he has a few dishes that hit the spot.  He's currently working in the Lion's Pride Inn if you'd like to learn the profession.
FemaleText: Tomas may not be the best cook around, but he has a few dishes that hit the spot.  He's currently working in the Lion's Pride Inn if you'd like to learn the profession.

MaleText: Why don't you try looking in the Lion's Pride Inn?  The cook there might be able to teach you a few good recipes.
FemaleText: Why don't you try looking in the Lion's Pride Inn?  The cook there might be able to teach you a few good recipes.

MaleText: Nope, don't think there are any Enchanters here in Elwynn Forest.  There's a guy named Lucan who runs a shop up in Stormwind though.  You could check with him and see if he will train you.
FemaleText: Nope, don't think there are any Enchanters here in Elwynn Forest.  There's a guy named Lucan who runs a shop up in Stormwind though.  You could check with him and see if he will train you.

MaleText: Hmmm... only enchanters I know of around here work out of Stormwind.  Why don't you ask one of the guards up in Stormwind?
FemaleText: Hmmm... only enchanters I know of around here work out of Stormwind.  Why don't you ask one of the guards up in Stormwind?

MaleText: I had a bad encounter with some of the Defias around here recently, but Michelle Belle fixed me up pretty well.  Check with her in the Lion's Pride Inn and see if she'll teach you.
FemaleText: I had a bad encounter with some of the Defias around here recently, but Michelle Belle fixed me up pretty well.  Check with her in the Lion's Pride Inn and see if she'll teach you.

MaleText: Michelle Belle's bedside manner is remarkable!  While she might not be able to teach you that, she surely could teach you some proper First Aid.  She currently resides in the Lion's Pride Inn.
FemaleText: Michelle Belle's bedside manner is remarkable!  While she might not be able to teach you that, she surely could teach you some proper First Aid.  She currently resides in the Lion's Pride Inn.

MaleText: Ms. Pomeroy gathers herbs for an Alchemist who lives up in the hills between Northshire and Stormwind.  Check for her at his cottage and see if she'll show you the profession.
FemaleText: Ms. Pomeroy gathers herbs for an Alchemist who lives up in the hills between Northshire and Stormwind.  Check for her at his cottage and see if she'll show you the profession.

MaleText: There's an herbalist that lives in the hills east of Stormwind with our alchemist. Quite the handy pairing don't you think?
FemaleText: There's an herbalist that lives in the hills east of Stormwind with our alchemist. Quite the handy pairing don't you think?

MaleText: You best head up to Stormwind in the Dwarven District if you want to learn to mine.  Surely one of the dwarves there can teach you the profession.
FemaleText: You best head up to Stormwind in the Dwarven District if you want to learn to mine.  Surely one of the dwarves there can teach you the profession.

MaleText: I think you'll have better luck looking in Stormwind.  Ask a guard up there and they'll point you in the right direction.
FemaleText: I think you'll have better luck looking in Stormwind.  Ask a guard up there and they'll point you in the right direction.

MaleText: Eldrin is the only one in Elwynn Forest that I would call a tailor.  You can find him at the Eastvale Lumber Camp if you're interested in learning the profession.
FemaleText: Eldrin is the only one in Elwynn Forest that I would call a tailor.  You can find him at the Eastvale Lumber Camp if you're interested in learning the profession.

MaleText: You want to learn to be a tailor?  Hmmm... I believe there's a tailor over in the Eastvale Logging Camp that may be able to get you started.
FemaleText: You want to learn to be a tailor?  Hmmm... I believe there's a tailor over in the Eastvale Logging Camp that may be able to get you started.

MaleText: What do ye need directions to?
FemaleText: What do ye need directions to?

MaleText: The nearest bank ye'll find is The Vault in Ironforge, $glad : lass;.
FemaleText: The nearest bank ye'll find is The Vault in Ironforge, $glad : lass;.

MaleText: The Vault in Ironforge is the closest bank ye'll find in these parts.
FemaleText: The Vault in Ironforge is the closest bank ye'll find in these parts.

MaleText: Which class trainer might ye be looking for?
FemaleText: Which class trainer might ye be looking for?

MaleText: There's only one hunter around here I would have ye talk to, and that would be Grif Wildheart.  Ye'll find him standing just outside the smithy in Kharanos.
FemaleText: There's only one hunter around here I would have ye talk to, and that would be Grif Wildheart.  Ye'll find him standing just outside the smithy in Kharanos.

MaleText: If ye ask me, I think Grif spends a little too much time with the animals.  Still, nobody else knows the hunter's path quite like he does.  Look for him outside the smithy in Kharanos.
FemaleText: If ye ask me, I think Grif spends a little too much time with the animals.  Still, nobody else knows the hunter's path quite like he does.  Look for him outside the smithy in Kharanos.

MaleText: Well then, it seems we're both looking for Hogral Bakkan.  He's a dwarf to be sure, so sooner or later he'll be heading for the Thunderbrew Distillery for an ale -- he might even be there now.
FemaleText: Well then, it seems we're both looking for Hogral Bakkan.  He's a dwarf to be sure, so sooner or later he'll be heading for the Thunderbrew Distillery for an ale -- he might even be there now.

MaleText: Ye looking for Hogral?  Well did ye check the tavern?  Och!  If yer looking for a rogue, and a dwarf one at that, ye should start in the Inn!  Go have a look already.
FemaleText: Ye looking for Hogral?  Well did ye check the tavern?  Och!  If yer looking for a rogue, and a dwarf one at that, ye should start in the Inn!  Go have a look already.

MaleText: Warlocks... I don't care for their lot.  Like that Grimrizz who's set up shop outside the Thunderbrew Distillery. The ale will probably go flat there because of him!  Warlocks... bah!
FemaleText: Warlocks... I don't care for their lot.  Like that Grimrizz who's set up shop outside the Thunderbrew Distillery. The ale will probably go flat there because of him!  Warlocks... bah!

MaleText: That kind of magic is just bad news, I tell ye.  I don't know why that Grimrizz has been allowed to set up outside the Thunderbrew Distillery of all places!  You stay away from him, you here!
FemaleText: That kind of magic is just bad news, I tell ye.  I don't know why that Grimrizz has been allowed to set up outside the Thunderbrew Distillery of all places!  You stay away from him, you here!

MaleText: Which profession trainer would ye be looking for?
FemaleText: Which profession trainer would ye be looking for?

MaleText: Och!  Now that's a skill worth knowing.  Tognus beats the anvil with a fury ye don't see often.  Why don't ye go talk him up and see what he can teach ye?
FemaleText: Och!  Now that's a skill worth knowing.  Tognus beats the anvil with a fury ye don't see often.  Why don't ye go talk him up and see what he can teach ye?

MaleText: Ye can probably hear Tognus beating away on the anvil when yer in Kharanos.  Although, if ye haven't cleared the wax out of yer ears recently, then why don't ye just have a look in the smithy.
FemaleText: Ye can probably hear Tognus beating away on the anvil when yer in Kharanos.  Although, if ye haven't cleared the wax out of yer ears recently, then why don't ye just have a look in the smithy.

MaleText: A Thunderbrew ale and a bit of Gremlock's cooking makes for a nice meal indeed.  Ye really should hit him up for some training if ye want to be a cook.
FemaleText: A Thunderbrew ale and a bit of Gremlock's cooking makes for a nice meal indeed.  Ye really should hit him up for some training if ye want to be a cook.

MaleText: Gremlock doesn't always have the best of luck with cooking, but he does have some tasty recipies worth learning.  Go chat him up in the Thunderbrew Distillery and see what he'll teach ye.
FemaleText: Gremlock doesn't always have the best of luck with cooking, but he does have some tasty recipies worth learning.  Go chat him up in the Thunderbrew Distillery and see what he'll teach ye.

MaleText: First Aid may not make up for a priest's healing, but it's handy in a pinch.  I recommend ye go talk to Thamner in the Thunderbrew Distillery and learn what ye can.
FemaleText: First Aid may not make up for a priest's healing, but it's handy in a pinch.  I recommend ye go talk to Thamner in the Thunderbrew Distillery and learn what ye can.

MaleText: Good ol' Thamner bandaged me up just the other day when I had a run in with a nasty trogg.  I'm good as new I tell ye!  I'm sure Thamner would be happy to show ye how to make a good bandage.
FemaleText: Good ol' Thamner bandaged me up just the other day when I had a run in with a nasty trogg.  I'm good as new I tell ye!  I'm sure Thamner would be happy to show ye how to make a good bandage.

MaleText: Amazing to see little flowers persist in the cold of Dun Morogh...  but ye won't find any herbalists out here.  Ye'll have to go to Ironforge to get some training in that profession.
FemaleText: Amazing to see little flowers persist in the cold of Dun Morogh...  but ye won't find any herbalists out here.  Ye'll have to go to Ironforge to get some training in that profession.

MaleText: Nope, nobody who can teach ye herbalism out here.  I think ye'll have better luck in Ironforge though.
FemaleText: Nope, nobody who can teach ye herbalism out here.  I think ye'll have better luck in Ironforge though.

MaleText: If ye're looking to learn the profession of leatherworking, ye're gonna need to travel to Ironforge.  I hear there's a nice shop near the Great Forge where ye can learn the profession.
FemaleText: If ye're looking to learn the profession of leatherworking, ye're gonna need to travel to Ironforge.  I hear there's a nice shop near the Great Forge where ye can learn the profession.

MaleText: Ironforge is going to be your best bet for leatherworkers.  If memory servers, there's a shop by The Great Forge that should meet yer needs.
FemaleText: Ironforge is going to be your best bet for leatherworkers.  If memory servers, there's a shop by The Great Forge that should meet yer needs.

MaleText: Surely ye didn't think ye would find a town without a resident miner about, did ye?  Yarr can usually be found over at Steelgrill's Depot just outside of Kharanos.
FemaleText: Surely ye didn't think ye would find a town without a resident miner about, did ye?  Yarr can usually be found over at Steelgrill's Depot just outside of Kharanos.

MaleText: A miner?  Ye don't need to ask if $glad : lass;, only where!  Yarr is who yer looking for, and I think ye can find him hiding out over in Steelgrill's Depot.
FemaleText: A miner?  Ye don't need to ask if $glad : lass;, only where!  Yarr is who yer looking for, and I think ye can find him hiding out over in Steelgrill's Depot.

MaleText: Ye won't find any skinners out in here Dun Morogh $glad : lass;, they're mostly to be found in Ironforge if ye're looking to be trained.
FemaleText: Ye won't find any skinners out in here Dun Morogh $glad : lass;, they're mostly to be found in Ironforge if ye're looking to be trained.

MaleText: The skinners usually take all their hides into Ironforge to dry out.  Why don't you head there and see if you can find one to train ye?
FemaleText: The skinners usually take all their hides into Ironforge to dry out.  Why don't you head there and see if you can find one to train ye?

MaleText: Ah, Stonebrow doesn't leave Ironforge much these days so if ye're looking to learn the tailor's profession ye'll have to go to see him up in Ironforge.
FemaleText: Ah, Stonebrow doesn't leave Ironforge much these days so if ye're looking to learn the tailor's profession ye'll have to go to see him up in Ironforge.

MaleText: Well, ye won't have much luck with finding a tailor out here.  Ironforge is home to a quite a few talented tailors though.  Why don't ye go ask a guard there.
FemaleText: Well, ye won't have much luck with finding a tailor out here.  Ironforge is home to a quite a few talented tailors though.  Why don't ye go ask a guard there.

MaleText: There are many places that you might visit in Teldrassil.  Tell me what you seek.
FemaleText: There are many places that you might visit in Teldrassil.  Tell me what you seek.

MaleText: To reach the Rut'theran Ferry, you will need to travel to Darnassus and take the portal to Rut'theran Village at the base of Teldrassil.
FemaleText: To reach the Rut'theran Ferry, you will need to travel to Darnassus and take the portal to Rut'theran Village at the base of Teldrassil.

MaleText: A Rut'theran Ferry leaves for Auberdine from Rut'theran Village at the base of Teldrassil.  The portal in Darnassus will allow you to reach Rut'theran safely.
FemaleText: A Rut'theran Ferry leaves for Auberdine from Rut'theran Village at the base of Teldrassil.  The portal in Darnassus will allow you to reach Rut'theran safely.

MaleText: A restful sleep is sure to be had in the beds which Innkeeper Keldamyr keeps at the Inn in Dolanaar.
FemaleText: A restful sleep is sure to be had in the beds which Innkeeper Keldamyr keeps at the Inn in Dolanaar.

MaleText: If you require time to rest and regain your strength, you will find the best at the Inn in Dolanaar.  Innkeeper Keldamyr will see to it that you are taken care of.
FemaleText: If you require time to rest and regain your strength, you will find the best at the Inn in Dolanaar.  Innkeeper Keldamyr will see to it that you are taken care of.

MaleText: You will find numerous trainers around Dolanaar with ages of experience with which to tutor you.  Which would you have me point you to?
FemaleText: You will find numerous trainers around Dolanaar with ages of experience with which to tutor you.  Which would you have me point you to?

MaleText: You seek the aid of a Druid?  Then you should go see Kal at the Moonwell just south of the Inn in Dolanaar.
FemaleText: You seek the aid of a Druid?  Then you should go see Kal at the Moonwell just south of the Inn in Dolanaar.

MaleText: The druid, Kal, often spends his time at the moonwell in Dolanaar.  I am certain he would be able to provide you with the training you require.
FemaleText: The druid, Kal, often spends his time at the moonwell in Dolanaar.  I am certain he would be able to provide you with the training you require.

MaleText: A priestess by the name of Laurna Morninglight calls Dolanaar home.  I believe she can be found just north of the Inn.
FemaleText: A priestess by the name of Laurna Morninglight calls Dolanaar home.  I believe she can be found just north of the Inn.

MaleText: Laurna Morninglight offers healing to those that live around Dolanaar.  Perhaps she would be able to teach you in the ways of a priest.
FemaleText: Laurna Morninglight offers healing to those that live around Dolanaar.  Perhaps she would be able to teach you in the ways of a priest.

MaleText: Kyra Windblade wields her blade with great skill.  She should be able to provide you with some training.  You'll find her at the Inn in Dolanaar.
FemaleText: Kyra Windblade wields her blade with great skill.  She should be able to provide you with some training.  You'll find her at the Inn in Dolanaar.

MaleText: I had the pleasure of seeing Kyra Windblade in combat once.  Considering what I witnessed, I am confident she will train you well.  Look for her at the Inn in Dolanaar.
FemaleText: I had the pleasure of seeing Kyra Windblade in combat once.  Considering what I witnessed, I am confident she will train you well.  Look for her at the Inn in Dolanaar.

MaleText: The path of those who undertake a profession is long and rewarding.  Which path do you choose to walk?
FemaleText: The path of those who undertake a profession is long and rewarding.  Which path do you choose to walk?

MaleText: While Cyndra is not bubbly like her potions, her kind manner is suitable for teaching her trade.  You can find her just east of the Inn in Dolanaar.
FemaleText: While Cyndra is not bubbly like her potions, her kind manner is suitable for teaching her trade.  You can find her just east of the Inn in Dolanaar.

MaleText: Cyndra's knowledge in alchemy is somewhat limited, but I'm sure it would be sufficient to get you started.  She practices her craft just east of the Inn in Dolanaar.
FemaleText: Cyndra's knowledge in alchemy is somewhat limited, but I'm sure it would be sufficient to get you started.  She practices her craft just east of the Inn in Dolanaar.

MaleText: Byancie has often lent her services to the sentinels who patrol the local wilds.  You should talk to her if you desire to learn First Aid.
FemaleText: Byancie has often lent her services to the sentinels who patrol the local wilds.  You should talk to her if you desire to learn First Aid.

MaleText: Byancie's skill in First Aid has proven useful on numerous occasions.  You can find her just north of the Inn in Dolanaar if you wish to learn from her.
FemaleText: Byancie's skill in First Aid has proven useful on numerous occasions.  You can find her just north of the Inn in Dolanaar if you wish to learn from her.

MaleText: Malorne somehow manages to pick the most delicate herbs without damaging them.  Certainly he is the one you should learn from.  He lives just east of the Inn in Dolanaar.
FemaleText: Malorne somehow manages to pick the most delicate herbs without damaging them.  Certainly he is the one you should learn from.  He lives just east of the Inn in Dolanaar.

MaleText: Herbalism requires a gentle touch that few such as Malorne can teach.  Seek him out east of the Inn in Dolanaar.
FemaleText: Herbalism requires a gentle touch that few such as Malorne can teach.  Seek him out east of the Inn in Dolanaar.

MaleText: The Maneweavers practice their professions out of their home on the road to Darnassus.  Nadyia is an excellent teacher when it comes to Leatherworking.  You should see what she can teach you.
FemaleText: The Maneweavers practice their professions out of their home on the road to Darnassus.  Nadyia is an excellent teacher when it comes to Leatherworking.  You should see what she can teach you.

MaleText: Nadyia has made quite the leatherworker in her years of practice.  Travel west on the road to Darnassus to pay her a visit and maybe she can bestow some of her knowledge upon you.
FemaleText: Nadyia has made quite the leatherworker in her years of practice.  Travel west on the road to Darnassus to pay her a visit and maybe she can bestow some of her knowledge upon you.

MaleText: You can find Radnaal practicing his craft outside his home on the road to Darnassus.  You should stop by and see what he can teach you.
FemaleText: You can find Radnaal practicing his craft outside his home on the road to Darnassus.  You should stop by and see what he can teach you.

MaleText: I am certain there is a Tailor that could provide you training in Darnassus.  When you arrive, ask one of the Sentinels in Darnassus about seeing a Tailor.
FemaleText: I am certain there is a Tailor that could provide you training in Darnassus.  When you arrive, ask one of the Sentinels in Darnassus about seeing a Tailor.

MaleText: Many of the supplies the tailors need come by way of Darnassus.  It is not surprising that they all moved there to work.  If you wish to be a tailor then you best head to Darnassus.
FemaleText: Many of the supplies the tailors need come by way of Darnassus.  It is not surprising that they all moved there to work.  If you wish to be a tailor then you best head to Darnassus.

MaleText: Hello, $c. I've set up camp here at the Bulwark to make my preparations for my journey into the Plaguelands. I've heard rumor that a great human wizard took up residency in Hearthglen not terribly long ago. He was commissioned by the Scarlet Crusade to fashion their warriors and hunters new bows and guns. It's said that he completed a remarkable weapon before the Crusade killed him.$B$BI guess their mistrust of the arcane has grown.

FemaleText: Greetings, $c. Don't have too much time to talk--I'm just using Chillwind as a camp to get some rest before heading to Hearthglen. I've heard word that before they went crazy, the Scarlet Crusade had a mage working for them who was trying to create powerful bows and guns for their soldiers. I'm not sure if he succeeded or not... the Crusade killed him before any of his finished product made it out. Maybe they killed him to keep it a secret... or maybe they distrust the arcane that much.

He... hello, $n. Sorry, I'm recovering from my wounds.$B$BThose Scarlet Crusaders are tougher than I had given them credit for. They almost did me in.$B$BYou should be careful too. I'd hate to see them get the jump on you.

My family worked  the Northridge Lumber Mill in what's now Western Plaguelands. They were dedicated to the Dumah family, and now the Scarlet Crusade have taken it over along with all of Hearthglen!$B$BI will not rest until those zealots are wiped from Azeroth.

MaleText: Long ago, before the last great war, my father ran the Northridge Lumber Mill. It was his life, and he was committed to it. Then the war came, and as much as it pained him, we had to flee to Stormwind.$B$BWe lost a number of friends and family in the those days, and it pains me to know that the Scarlet Crusade has taken the mill for their own ends.$B$BThat's why I've returned.

We are the last of the furbolg race... The Timbermaw tribe remains uncorrupted, yet we face the same hostility from outsiders; most believe that it is not possible... that there could actually be furbolg that escaped the corruption...$B$BAngry at those that strive to make enemies too quickly, my brethren now attack any that draw near; they trust no one.$B$BBut perhaps, if you strive to make your presence peaceful with them, they might look upon you as an ally.

You must find a way to show that you both are fighting for the same side. Although the Timbermaw may attack you now, if you are diligent, you will find a way.$B$BYou must remember that any attacks on the Timbermaw furbolg directly will greatly hinder your chances of gaining them as an ally.$B$BA good place to start would be the Deadwood furbolg found in many parts of Felwood. These furbolg are the enemy of the Timbermaw tribe, and slaying them would greatly improve your standing with the Timbermaw.
We Timbermaw can grant you safe passage through the hold, however, you must prove yourself worthy of our aid.

The Winterfall furbolg that reside here in Winterspring were once our allies... But one day, that all changed.$B$BDriven by the strange demands of their high chief, they began to attack all others that they came in contact with, including our tribe. They keep to themselves now...
I trust very few of your kind, $n. But I can tell that you are a friend.
Yes, yes. I see you.$B$BBe on your way. You may have earned the trust of a few, but it will take more than that to prove it to me!
If you prove that you are a true ally, I might consider training you...
Do not turn your back on the Light, $c, it may be the one thing that saves you some day.
FemaleText: Do not turn your back on the Light, $c, it may be the one thing that saves you some day.

MaleText: I trust the Light is with you, $n. Is there something that I can I help you with?
FemaleText: I trust the Light is with you, $n. Is there something that I can I help you with?

MaleText: The Light protect you, $c.
FemaleText: The Light protect you, $c.

MaleText: I hope the Light is with you, $n. Is there anything I can do for you today?
FemaleText: I hope the Light is with you, $n. Is there anything I can do for you today?

MaleText: You be watchin' yerself, $c. Respect our ways, or a curse be on you and yours.
FemaleText: You be watchin' yerself, $c. Respect our ways, or a curse be on you and yours.
