I will instruct you when the time is right... that time is not now. You have much more to learn first!
Good! I can tell that my efforts will not be wasted!
I have outfitted kings. With the proper training, you can too.
You have come a long way, traveler. There is one more task for you to perform...
I cannot help you until you have learned more of the essentials. Come back to me when you are ready.
The place is a bit drafty... but what do I care? I'm dead.
You're doing very well in the art of tailoring, I must admit. Now, let's see how good you REALLY are...
Who sent you here? You're not ready for my instruction yet! You'll be told when you're ready.

FemaleText: I do so enjoy sitting out here, listening to the sounds of the Great Sea.  Oh, what?  Yes, there is a ship that will take you to Menethil Harbor.  It docks here from time to time.

MaleText: Mark my words!  You won't find faster gryphons anywhere in the Eastern Kingdoms than the ones right here in Thelsamar!
If you ask me, there's no greater profession than a miner.  And if you ask me, there's no greater miner than a dwarf!
The Wildhammer dwarves might have fast steeds, but can those Aerie Peak gryphons stand the heat of The Great Forge?  I think not!
The best miner has a firm grip on $ghis:her; pick, a stout heart in $ghis:her; chest, and thick, black dust in $ghis:her; hair.
The sturdy crate sits in the middle of the lumber mill surrounded by debris and very zealous followers of the Scarlet Crusade.

FemaleText: This bear wanders a path close to where the Talondeep Path lies, due west of Mystral Lake and the Alliance outpost of Silverwind Refuge.  While he is the easiest of the three creatures you will face on the Ashenvale Hunt, he should not be trifled with.  His presence is a constant threat to travelers who sojourn between Ashenvale and the Stonetalon Mountains.

This nightsaber is rumored to be docile in the presence of night elves and their allies, which makes her an even more worthy opponent.  Shadumbra's hunting path takes her from the Raynewood Retreat to our west, ultimately to lands due west of there.  Her fur is the color of pitch, and her speed is not to be underestimated.

The mightiest of all the beasts that make up the Ashenvale Hunt, Sharptalon is let to wander freely by the self-proclaimed guardians of this land, the night elves.  Sharptalon patrols for prey to the south of here, taking delight in rending the unsuspecting and unaware traveler limb from limb.$B$BTo bring down such a beast would be the mightiest of hauls, $n.  I wish you luck in the hunt for this creature!

MaleText: Greeting $c - welcome to the front lines in our conquest of Ashenvale!  If you are looking for something to do, then you've come to the right place.  I'm always looking for able-bodied individuals to help bring glory to the Horde!

The dragon hides behind a royal facade. The tablets will reveal her for what she is... If what I have seen holds true, I will not survive this battle, friend. It is you that must finish what I have started. Are your forces ready? Are you ready? We will begin on your command.

If you want to know about the comings and goings of caravans and merchants here in Splintertree Post, then I am fortunately the orc you are looking for.  Unfortunately for you though, I don't like people.$B$BIf you want something, make it quick.
The elements speak to us, $c.  They share knowledge that we must learn, and they share secrets that must be kept.

Through rigorous retraining I have had to break many students of all they had previously learned so that I might teach them anew.  The service I offer becomes increasingly difficult to perform each time it is done.  It is for that reason that it becomes increasingly expensive with each retraining.  Do you desire that I break you of the talents you have learned?
FemaleText: Through rigorous retraining I have had to break many students of all they had previously learned so that I might teach them anew.  The service I offer becomes increasingly difficult to perform each time it is done.  It is for that reason that it becomes increasingly expensive with each retraining.  Do you desire that I break you of the talents you have learned?

MaleText: If you desire, in addition to training, I have it within my power to erase the knowledge of your talents from your mind.  Be warned that every time you undergo this procedure the more difficult it is to perform, and therefore the more expensive it becomes.
FemaleText: If you desire, in addition to training, I have it within my power to erase the knowledge of your talents from your mind.  Be warned that every time you undergo this procedure the more difficult it is to perform, and therefore the more expensive it becomes.

MaleText: Look at the wisdom and knowledge of the beast, and you will see yourself. Observe as the owl does, learn cleverness from the sabercat, embody the mighty spirit of the wolf.
FemaleText: Look at the wisdom and knowledge of the beast, and you will see yourself. Observe as the owl does, learn cleverness from the sabercat, embody the mighty spirit of the wolf.

MaleText: The arcane only corrupts those who are weak. Keep up on your training, or you may find a similar fate.
FemaleText: The arcane only corrupts those who are weak. Keep up on your training, or you may find a similar fate.

MaleText: Welcome, my $g brother : sister;.  If you are here to train, then I would be delighted to train you.$B$BThere will be a time soon where the call of the Emerald Dream will take hold in you.  You will hibernate for many years and walk amongst the purest of forms.  It is there and then that your ultimate training will take place.
FemaleText: Welcome, my $g brother : sister;.  If you are here to train, then I would be delighted to train you.$B$BThere will be a time soon where the call of the Emerald Dream will take hold in you.  You will hibernate for many years and walk amongst the purest of forms.  It is there and then that your ultimate training will take place.

MaleText: What can I do for ya?
FemaleText: What can I do for ya?

MaleText: I got nothin' more to teach! Not for somebody who knows as much as you do, anyway! You Horde types need to talk to Nogg in Orgrimmar!

FemaleText: I mean you no harm. I am scouting the quilboar and taking notes of their activities. My people have noticed something odd--an emanation or darkness--coming from this area. I've come to investigate, and what I've found is very disturbing.$B$BThere seems to be an undead diplomat who is powerful in the ways of the arcane. I don't believe he's one of the Forsaken... I think it's worse.

MaleText: You know enough to be dangerous, but you still look like you need training to me $n.
FemaleText: You know enough to be dangerous, but you still look like you need training to me $n.

MaleText: Your will is not strong enough to manipulate the forces we control $c.
FemaleText: Your will is not strong enough to manipulate the forces we control $c.

MaleText: $n, how may I further your training in the eyes of the Earth Mother?
FemaleText: $n, how may I further your training in the eyes of the Earth Mother?

MaleText: Many are the paths of the Earth Mother.  May your ancestors watch over you $c.
FemaleText: Many are the paths of the Earth Mother.  May your ancestors watch over you $c.

MaleText: It is wise that you humble yourself before me $N in your desire for more warlock knowledge.
FemaleText: It is wise that you humble yourself before me $N in your desire for more warlock knowledge.

MaleText: I have no time to waste on the likes of you $c.
FemaleText: I have no time to waste on the likes of you $c.

MaleText: I can tell just by the way you're standing that you're no warrior.  $B$BWhy don't you go do something safe, like read a book.
FemaleText: I can tell just by the way you're standing that you're no warrior.  $B$BWhy don't you go do something safe, like read a book.

MaleText: The darkness does not embrace you, $c.  Cease your prattle and remove yourself from my sight!  Be gone!
FemaleText: The darkness does not embrace you, $c.  Cease your prattle and remove yourself from my sight!  Be gone!

MaleText: Yer no warrior... Why ye wouldn't even last a day under my training regimen!  $B$BA $c who thinks $ghe's : she's; a warrior.  Ha!
FemaleText: Yer no warrior... Why ye wouldn't even last a day under my training regimen!  $B$BA $c who thinks $ghe's : she's; a warrior.  Ha!

MaleText: I do not see the warrior's spirit within you, child.  I have no teachings which would benefit a $c such as yourself.
FemaleText: I do not see the warrior's spirit within you, child.  I have no teachings which would benefit a $c such as yourself.

MaleText: The Shattered Hand has been able to place spies throughout the upper citadel of Blackrock. Though the information gathering process has been slow, we have made discoveries that cannot be ignored.

It would appear as if the influence of the Black Dragonflight had extended beyond the borders of the Burning Steppes and into the kingdom of Stormwind itself! The usurper has since been unmasked and ousted.

Indeed. The brood mother of the Black Dragonflight had used illusion and trickery to disguise herself as a member of the royal court. Worse yet, she had assumed control of the current Highlord of Stormwind, Bolvar Fordragon.$B$BIt is no wonder that such foolish military decisions had been made. The movement of the Alliance forces as of late had left us scratching our heads. We now understand that the Black Flight was attempting to divide the empire - destroy it from within.

<Thrall laughs.>$B$BSo much to learn still, $r.$B$BYou are too young to remember the wars and bloodshed of ages past. Too young to remember the burden of the curse carried by our people.$B$BOur position with the Alliance right now is a tenuous one. Skirmishes and smaller battles do take place, but there is peace - something our people have not known for millennia. Would you give this up and plunge us into the maw of chaos again but against a new foe? One that will not rest until we are all destroyed?

No, $n, you did not. I do not fault you, however, as yours is a mind much like mine was as a youth: Impetuous, rebellious, and often without a single coherent thought! Traits I can no longer afford to express.$B$BEnough lamenting. $R, I have a task for you; one that you may not survive.

<Thrall laughs.>$B$BNoted... Now pay attention, $n. The Black Dragonflight brood mother, Onyxia, has been flushed out from her position of power in Stormwind. She has escaped, fleeing to her lair in Dustwallow Marsh.$B$BShe cannot be allowed to live in such close proximity to our capital cities. We must strike before being struck!$B$BI want her destroyed, $n.

Welcome, my $g brother : sister;.  If you are here to train, then I would be delighted to train you.$B$BWe are the preservers of the balance, now and forever, as Malfurion lies in the Dreaming.  Never forget this.

Welcome, my $g brother : sister;.  If you are here to train, then I would be delighted to train you.$B$BWe are the preservers of the balance, now and forever, as Malfurion lies in the Dreaming.  Never forget this.
I see some interesting characters come and go here at the port. Watch yourself, $n. It's never clear who to trust, what with all of the shady activity that goes on here...
So you're here for the Warsong axes. Well, it's about time, $n. That crate has been sitting out there for days, now.$B$BFeel free to haul it away whenever you are ready.

Stonetalon Mountain has many perilous caves through out this region.  Exploring these caves can hold many adventures for those willing to risk life for glory.$B$B$C, perhaps you seek riches that only following your heart and soul can garnish.
Fish so delicious. You come learn fish? Eat fish? Mmmmm...
Yap, I can teach ye to fish.

FemaleText: Please, leave this place, $n. You know nothing of what troubles us...

MaleText: We may have been suffering a drought but there's no shortage of meat! Care to browse my goods?

FemaleText: Can Zamja help you, $r?

MaleText: I keep 'em fed, kid. Yep, Daryl Riknussun, at yer service.
I am an orc of medicine, $r. If you have come here to learn, I shall do my best to teach.

FemaleText: Are you a student of the medical sciences?
Why have you come here, $c?
My people, they are as shattered as the relic you seek to repair.

MaleText: Greetings, $c. Is there something I can help you with?
My question to you is this, $c:$BWhich of the Aspects created by the titans became the nefarious creature known as Deathwing?
It's always nice when someone wishes to speak to me. How are things with you, $c?
Now, answer me this, $n:$BWhich creature became the Lich King before spreading the plague across Lordaeron?
Yeah, you know a few things! If you wanna' learn more you're gonna' have to talk to Georgio Bolero in Stormwind.

The Thorium Brotherhood possesses the knowledge required to make the sacred arms and armaments of the Fire Lord, but we lack the manpower to obtain the materials required for the crafting.$B$BI, Lokhtos Darkbargainer, have been empowered by the Brotherhood to exchange the exalted recipes for materials gathered from the Molten Core.$B$BPresent your offer, $r.
Want to make your demons more powerful?  It'll cost you, but you've come to the right place.
FemaleText: Want to make your demons more powerful?  It'll cost you, but you've come to the right place.

MaleText: You're no warlock and I've no time for you.  Begone!
FemaleText: You're no warlock and I've no time for you.  Begone!

MaleText: You've come for training in order to pass it on to your pets?
FemaleText: You've come for training in order to pass it on to your pets?

MaleText: Ah friend, I only help hunters and their pets.
FemaleText: Ah friend, I only help hunters and their pets.

MaleText: The Royal Apothecary Society has little patience for fools, as do I.  Perhaps the next time you and I speak of my steeds, you will be considered exalted by the Undercity.  Until then...
FemaleText: The Royal Apothecary Society has little patience for fools, as do I.  Perhaps the next time you and I speak of my steeds, you will be considered exalted by the Undercity.  Until then...

MaleText: I only make my mounts available to those who are considered exalted to Orgrimmar and the Orcish race.  Go prove yourself to us, and I'll make my mighty wolves available for your inspection.
FemaleText: I only make my mounts available to those who are considered exalted to Orgrimmar and the Orcish race.  Go prove yourself to us, and I'll make my mighty wolves available for your inspection.

MaleText: I'm sorry $g mon : sis;, but I won't be sellin' my raptors to someone who hasn't proven themselves to be exalted to the Darkspear tribe.  When ya make a stand and show yourself to be no less than exalted to us, then I'll make my raptors available to ya.
FemaleText: I'm sorry $g mon : sis;, but I won't be sellin' my raptors to someone who hasn't proven themselves to be exalted to the Darkspear tribe.  When ya make a stand and show yourself to be no less than exalted to us, then I'll make my raptors available to ya.

MaleText: You are not known to my people.  A kodo is a mighty steed, and it is the product of love and care by my people; such is not given onto strangers.  Until the elders of Thunder Bluff consider you to be exalted, I cannot offer you the sale of a kodo.
FemaleText: You are not known to my people.  A kodo is a mighty steed, and it is the product of love and care by my people; such is not given onto strangers.  Until the elders of Thunder Bluff consider you to be exalted, I cannot offer you the sale of a kodo.

MaleText: Alas $c, you are not considered to be exalted to Darnassus and the night elves of Teldrassil.  Only when you prove yourself to us through deeds - not just mere words - will I then make available my selection of mounts for your perusal.
FemaleText: Alas $c, you are not considered to be exalted to Darnassus and the night elves of Teldrassil.  Only when you prove yourself to us through deeds - not just mere words - will I then make available my selection of mounts for your perusal.

MaleText: Plucky?  I heard race master Kronkrider up on the the tower knows where he is.
FemaleText: Plucky?  I heard race master Kronkrider up on the the tower knows where he is.

MaleText: You looking for plucky?  Well, you didn't hear me say this, but... maybe if you ask Kronkrider up in the tower, he'll tell you...
FemaleText: You looking for plucky?  Well, you didn't hear me say this, but... maybe if you ask Kronkrider up in the tower, he'll tell you...

MaleText: Sorry, but I am not disposed to sell horses to any individual who is not considered to be at least exalted to the Kingdom of Stormwind.  These steeds are the finest you'll find anywhere, and we certainly wouldn't want them in the hands of our enemies.$B$BNot saying you're an enemy, of course... just earn the trust of Stormwind and then we can do business.
FemaleText: Sorry, but I am not disposed to sell horses to any individual who is not considered to be at least exalted to the Kingdom of Stormwind.  These steeds are the finest you'll find anywhere, and we certainly wouldn't want them in the hands of our enemies.$B$BNot saying you're an enemy, of course... just earn the trust of Stormwind and then we can do business.

MaleText: Not so fast, $g guy : lady;... I'll not be handing out the reigns of a mighty ram steed to someone that's not a proven ally of the dwarves of Ironforge.  Once you've been recognized as exalted to Ironforge, I'll gladly show you what varieties of rams I have for sale.
FemaleText: Not so fast, $g guy : lady;... I'll not be handing out the reigns of a mighty ram steed to someone that's not a proven ally of the dwarves of Ironforge.  Once you've been recognized as exalted to Ironforge, I'll gladly show you what varieties of rams I have for sale.

MaleText: Erm... I really don't know you that well, sorry.  I mean, as an authorized Mechano-strider dealer, I really only can sell my mounts to those people who are considered exalted amongst the gnomes.  If you ever are recognized as exalted to Gnomeregan, I'd be happy to show you what I have to offer.
FemaleText: Erm... I really don't know you that well, sorry.  I mean, as an authorized Mechano-strider dealer, I really only can sell my mounts to those people who are considered exalted amongst the gnomes.  If you ever are recognized as exalted to Gnomeregan, I'd be happy to show you what I have to offer.

MaleText: You need to be exalted with the dwarves of Ironforge before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
FemaleText: You need to be exalted with the dwarves of Ironforge before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.

MaleText: You need to be exalted with the Forsaken of the Undercity before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
FemaleText: You need to be exalted with the Forsaken of the Undercity before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.

MaleText: You need to be exalted with the gnomes of the Gnomeregan Exiles before I will teach you how to pilot a Mechanostrider, $c.
FemaleText: You need to be exalted with the gnomes of the Gnomeregan Exiles before I will teach you how to pilot a Mechanostrider, $c.

MaleText: You need to be exalted with the humans of Stormwind before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
FemaleText: You need to be exalted with the humans of Stormwind before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.

MaleText: You need to be exalted with the night elves of Darnassus before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
FemaleText: You need to be exalted with the night elves of Darnassus before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.

MaleText: You need to be exalted with the orcs of Orgrimmar before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
FemaleText: You need to be exalted with the orcs of Orgrimmar before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.

MaleText: You need to be exalted with the tauren of Thunder Bluff before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
FemaleText: You need to be exalted with the tauren of Thunder Bluff before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.

MaleText: You need to be exalted with the trolls of the Darkspear tribe before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
FemaleText: You need to be exalted with the trolls of the Darkspear tribe before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
I do not believe you possess the mental acuity to grasp the nature of portal magic.
As a mage, you are one of a select group that can conjure a portal to transport you back to this very place.  I can teach you if you are ready.
I do not believe you possess the mental acuity to grasp the nature of portal magic.
As a mage, you are one of a select group that can conjure a portal to transport you back to this very place.  I can teach you if you are ready.

MaleText: I do not believe you possess the mental acuity to grasp the nature of portal magic.
As a mage, you are one of a select group that can conjure a portal to transport you back to this very place.  I can teach you if you are ready.
I do not believe you possess the mental acuity to grasp the nature of portal magic.
FemaleText: I do not believe you possess the mental acuity to grasp the nature of portal magic.

MaleText: As a mage, you are one of a select group that can conjure a portal to transport you back to this very place.  I can teach you if you are ready.
FemaleText: As a mage, you are one of a select group that can conjure a portal to transport you back to this very place.  I can teach you if you are ready.
I do not believe you possess the mental acuity to grasp the nature of portal magic.
As a mage, you are one of a select group that can conjure a portal to transport you back to this very place.  I can teach you if you are ready.

MaleText: I do not believe you possess the mental acuity to grasp the nature of portal magic.
As a mage, you are one of a select group that can conjure a portal to transport you back to this very place.  I can teach you if you are ready.
I do not believe you possess the mental acuity to grasp the nature of portal magic.
As a mage, you are one of a select group that can conjure a portal to transport you back to this very place.  I can teach you if you are ready.
Monty be me name an' rats be me game.
The strongest hides come from those kodo that have laid themselves to rest in this wasteland.

FemaleText: Between the light and the dark, there is shadow... and those shadows have powers you have yet to see.
Between the light and the dark, there is shadow... and those shadows have powers you have yet to see.

MaleText: You'll find no finer rat kabob this side of Khaz Modan!
You look like you could use some work, $g fella:lady;. You should board the tram and visit my brother, Monty, at the Ironforge Deeprun Tram depot. I'm sure he has something you could do.
Watch your back, stranger.
Ravenholdt Manor does not recognize you, $c.
Brash. Master Ravenholdt does not like brash.
It is good to see you again, $n.
Greetings, $c. Have you spoken with Fahrad yet?
The Syndicate is made up of a bunch of hacks - disorganized, unskilled, and lazy...
You dare set foot inside Ravenholdt Manor, worm?
FemaleText: You dare set foot inside Ravenholdt Manor, worm?

MaleText: Making it out of here without a blade in your back or poison in your veins would be an accomplishment.
FemaleText: Making it out of here without a blade in your back or poison in your veins would be an accomplishment.

MaleText: You're shaping up nicely, $n. I've heard good things...
FemaleText: You're shaping up nicely, $n. I've heard good things...

MaleText: You should talk to Winstone. I hear he's looking for thieves with your skill.
FemaleText: You should talk to Winstone. I hear he's looking for thieves with your skill.
May Elune walk with you, $c.  The Temple of the Moon has come to help the troubled citizens of Auberdine.

MaleText: Go to the Valley of Honor and seek out Xon'cha near the stables.
FemaleText: Go to the Valley of Honor and seek out Xon'cha near the stables.

MaleText: Xon'cha will stable your extra pets.  Find him in the Valley of Honor at the stables between the arena and the Hunter's Hall.  Now begone!
FemaleText: Xon'cha will stable your extra pets.  Find him in the Valley of Honor at the stables between the arena and the Hunter's Hall.  Now begone!

MaleText: It is the assistance of Bulrug that you need.  You will find him outside on the lower rise standing between the inn and the Thunder Bluff Bank.
FemaleText: It is the assistance of Bulrug that you need.  You will find him outside on the lower rise standing between the inn and the Thunder Bluff Bank.

MaleText: The concern that you show for the welfare of your animal companions is commendable.  Bulrug, on the lower rise, can help you with that.  Seek him out between the bank and the inn.
FemaleText: The concern that you show for the welfare of your animal companions is commendable.  Bulrug, on the lower rise, can help you with that.  Seek him out between the bank and the inn.

MaleText: Morganus the stable master can be found out in front of the stables strangely enough.
FemaleText: Morganus the stable master can be found out in front of the stables strangely enough.

MaleText: Not too clever are you?  Hmm, if I were a stable master perhaps I might be in the vicinity of say, the stable?  Look for Morganus over there.
FemaleText: Not too clever are you?  Hmm, if I were a stable master perhaps I might be in the vicinity of say, the stable?  Look for Morganus over there.

MaleText: Anya Maulray at inn on upper ring of Trade Quarter.
FemaleText: Anya Maulray at inn on upper ring of Trade Quarter.

MaleText: Us want lots of pets.  Anya Maulray help you take care of them.  You find her at inn, upper ring of Trade Quarter.
FemaleText: Us want lots of pets.  Anya Maulray help you take care of them.  You find her at inn, upper ring of Trade Quarter.

MaleText: You can trust any pets you have to be well taken care of by Alassin.  He resides in the Cenarion Enclave where the hunters gather.
FemaleText: You can trust any pets you have to be well taken care of by Alassin.  He resides in the Cenarion Enclave where the hunters gather.

MaleText: For many hundreds of years Alassin has cared for the animals that our hunters befriend.  His care of animals is highly sought for by the hunters around here.  If you seek him as well, then look for him in the Cenarion Enclave.
FemaleText: For many hundreds of years Alassin has cared for the animals that our hunters befriend.  His care of animals is highly sought for by the hunters around here.  If you seek him as well, then look for him in the Cenarion Enclave.

MaleText: We are all pieces of a much larger puzzle, $n. Just as you guide the piece of a puzzle to its destination, so too are we guided by another.$B$BAnd perhaps they who guide us are themselves guided by an even greater force.
Good ol' Erma, she's been taking care of the local animals for years now.  I'm sure she'd be happy to take care of any you'd like to put up.  She can be found right outside of the Lion's Pride Inn.
FemaleText: Good ol' Erma, she's been taking care of the local animals for years now.  I'm sure she'd be happy to take care of any you'd like to put up.  She can be found right outside of the Lion's Pride Inn.

MaleText: Erma does all the caring for animals around here.  She's right outside the Lion's Pride Inn if you need to speak with her.
FemaleText: Erma does all the caring for animals around here.  She's right outside the Lion's Pride Inn if you need to speak with her.

MaleText: Jenova Stoneshield over in the Dwarven District is the one you're looking for.  She tends to hunters' pets while they seek training from her father.
FemaleText: Jenova Stoneshield over in the Dwarven District is the one you're looking for.  She tends to hunters' pets while they seek training from her father.

MaleText: If you need to house your pet while you're training another, then you should talk to Jenova Stoneshield over in the Dwarven District.
FemaleText: If you need to house your pet while you're training another, then you should talk to Jenova Stoneshield over in the Dwarven District.

MaleText: Taking care of animals is something that Ulbrek Firehand takes quite seriously.  He usually hangs out with the hunters at the Hall of Arms if ye want him to look after a pet or two.
FemaleText: Taking care of animals is something that Ulbrek Firehand takes quite seriously.  He usually hangs out with the hunters at the Hall of Arms if ye want him to look after a pet or two.

MaleText: Over in the Hall of Arms you can find our resident stable master, Ulbrek Firehand.  He'll make sure any pets ye have are well fed and rightly cared for.
FemaleText: Over in the Hall of Arms you can find our resident stable master, Ulbrek Firehand.  He'll make sure any pets ye have are well fed and rightly cared for.

MaleText: I got something for you, $n. Looks important.
FemaleText: I got something for you, $n. Looks important.

MaleText: Welcome to SI:7 headquarters, $n.
$n, this came for you this morning.
Messengers from Ravenholdt delivered this letter to me this morning. It is addressed to you, $n.
FemaleText: Messengers from Ravenholdt delivered this letter to me this morning. It is addressed to you, $n.

MaleText: Yes, $c? Are you reporting in?
The Irondeep Mine is in Alliance territory, north of the Stormpike Graveyard.$B$BIt is controlled by the Troggs.

This monument is dedicated to all those who have fallen in the protection of Stormwind. Our people have weathered unbelievable hardships to retain their freedoms and to control their own destinies. It is here we remember every sacrifice our citizens have made during the first war that riddled our people.
In Alterac Valley, battles rage and equipment is in short supply.

FemaleText: The blood of our enemies shall be spilt upon the battlefield. The great elementals shall answer our call and crush all that stand in our way.
Good work, soldier. I need to get back to base camp! Will you cover me?
About damn time someone came. What took you so long? Ah, nevermind. Cover me, soldier. I gotta make it back to base!
There is much work left to be done, $n! Continue to strike down our enemies!
Yes, $n. The elements are stirring. Soon, we will unleash their might upon our enemies. They shall reel from the blows!
I have made contact, $n. It is Lokholar the Ice Lord. He has deemed our cause worthy - our earth bound sacrifice sufficient. He comes soon... prepare yourself.

MaleText: I need a few good wing men to get me out of here safely and back to base.
The pages of the journal seem to be filled with information about trades, buyers  and other miscellaneous business related events.

FemaleText: Never look the Commander directly in the eyes.
We are under direct orders from Cairne, $r. Do not interfere with the Commander's task.
The Shaman Commander is not to be trifled with, $r.
Soon, Lokholar shall rise... Soon... Very, very soon...
The fleet is ready, $n. You must take this beacon and place it at the eastern crater of the central battlezone. Defend the beacon from attackers until the fleet is able to lock on to its coordinates!

MaleText: I am Hydraxis, Duke of the Waterlords.  You are not an elemental and so cannot understand our struggle, but perhaps we can strike a deal that will benefit us both...

FemaleText: The fleet is ready, $n. You must take this beacon and place it at the western crater of the central battlezone. Defend the beacon from attackers until the fleet is able to lock on to its coordinates!

MaleText: The time has come to prove your worth as a wing man, $n. Take this beacon and plant it dead center of the Snowfall graveyard. Defend it until my fleet arrives.$B$B<Mulverick salutes.>

If you're looking for information that the Cenarion Circle might have archived somewhere, then I'm the one to talk to.  Then again, you need to know what information you're looking for first before I can really help you.$B$BSee how that works?  Brilliant!
Don't listen to the hearts of the world - the answer lies within.  You know the truth.
The past lives in these wastes, $c.  We must be careful to not awaken it.

$n, you are ready for the ultimate task.  The fiery runes etched on the floor of the molten core are conduits to the realm of fire, and their presence is both an affront to us and a source of power for the Firelords.  They must be extinguished!$B$BTo extinguish a rune, take a vial of aqual quintessence.  Pour it on the rune and its flame will go out, rendering it useless and weakening our enemy!
Welcome to the Undercity Guild Registry. What do you want?
Welcome to the Cenarion Circle, $c.  How may I assist you?
Speak with Hydraxis.
You have no business with me, little one.
Speak not your vulgar language to me!  Only Hydraxis can stand it.
Greetings, little one.  You have business with the Waterlords?
Tales of your exploits spread.  Your name is not unknown to us, $n.
You have made our enemies your own.  I will gladly share waters with you.
I don't think you want to learn anything I can teach. Might want to find a $c trainer to help you out.
FemaleText: I don't think you want to learn anything I can teach. Might want to find a $c trainer to help you out.

MaleText: You look like the type I should watch my coin purse around. Something I can help you with?
FemaleText: You look like the type I should watch my coin purse around. Something I can help you with?

MaleText: We have been sent here from Darnassus to aid the Stormpike in their time of need.
The Arch Druid believes that Ivus the Forest Lord will come once he is made aware of the destructive forces within this valley.
It is not for us to judge these atrocities. Ivus will pass judgement once he arrives.

FemaleText: My faith guides my actions, $r. I know that Ivus will come.
I have been lost in the Dream. I sense his lifeforce but my powers have not yet grown strong enough to make contact.
Yes. $n. I have located the Forest Lord. We must redouble our efforts! More crystals are needed!
The Forest Lord is aware of the destruction in this valley, $n. Soon we must make our way to the Circle of Calling. Prepare yourself!

MaleText: I was shot down by that reckless fool, Mulverick. I fear that if I do not make it back to base, all will be lost! Mulverick and his squad of War Riders must be stopped!

I can't believe it... I was doing a routine recon mission over the central DMZ when all hell broke loose. I saw the Horde Wing Commander, Mulverick, take out both Ichman and Slidore! Anger took hold of me and I broke from my wing man and drove that bastard Mulverick down. Unfortunately, he clipped my gryphon before he crashed, forcing me down as well. I ended up captured by these savages.$B$BI have to get back to base! Help!

I heard their mocking laughter as my gryphon crashed and burned, $c.$B$B"Slidore, you stink!" They shouted.$B$BNobody talks to Slidore that way! Help me get out of here so that I can show them who the real stinker is!

FemaleText: This forest can be confusing! Be careful out there.

MaleText: Pay attention, soldier! You need to take this beacon to the Snowfall graveyard and plant it! Protect it long enough so that my gryphon can lock on.$B$BIf my gryphon gets a solid strike location, Mulv and his crew will be humiliated!
$n! Finally!$B$BYou must take this beacon and plant it in the eastern crater of the central battle grounds. My flight will attack when the beacon beams its coordinates!
The gryphons are ready to strike, $n! You must take this beacon and plant it in the western crater of the central battlegrounds.$B$BDo this and the battle is ours!
Our units are not upgraded, and I don't have enough supplies to upgrade them.
Our units are upgraded to Seasoned, but I don't have enough supplies to upgrade them to Veteran.
Our units are upgraded to Veteran, but I don't have enough supplies to upgrade them to Champion.
I have enough supplies to upgrade  our troops to seasoned.
I have enough supplies to upgrade our troops to veterans.
I have enough supplies to upgrade our troops to champions.
Our units are upgraded to Champions, but I can still collect more supplies.
Here to learn how to wield a new weapon, or just to waste my time?

Ansekhwa, the tauren weapon master, is on Thunder Bluff's lower rise.  He can train one and two-handed maces, staves and guns.~~Hanashi, standing next to me here, can instruct in the use of bows, one and two-handed axes, staves and all manner of thrown weapons.~~Archibald, the undead weapon master in the War Quarter of the Undercity, can teach the use of crossbows, daggers, one and two-handed swords and polearms.
They say an army travels on its stomach, and that's the truth.  For any offensive to succeed, your troops have to be well-fed and well supplied.

Some say that strength and bravery are most needed for an army's success.  And it's true!  But an army also needs supplies to keep itself in good shape, and it's my job to make sure they have what they need.

FemaleText: Greetings, soldier. Are you here to help the cause?
Well done, soldier. A few more and our stables will be overflowing with mounts for the cavalry to ride into combat!

MaleText: Heya mon.  You come right place learn how ta wield a new weapon.

Ansekhwa, da tauren weapon master, is on da Thunder Bluff lower rise.  He teach one and two-handed maces, staves and guns.~~Archibald, da undead weapon master in da War Quarter of da Undercity, train good with crossbows, daggers, one and two-handed swords and polearms.~~Sayoc, da ugly orc right here, can teach da ways of bows, daggers, fist weapons, one and two-handed axes and thrown weapons mon.
I would be honored to train you in the use of the weapons that I have mastered should you have the ability to learn within you.

$n!  Our supplies are dwindling and until we get more we can't launch large ground assaults into the Field of Strife!$B$BSpeak with the Stormpike Quartermaster.  He'll tell you what you can do to resupply our assault forces.

Sayoc is the orc weapon master and is located in Orgrimmar's Valley of Honor.  He instructs in the use of bows, daggers, fist weapons, one and two-handed axes and thrown weapons.~~Hanashi, the troll weapon master in the Valley of Honor of Orgrimmar, can teach the use of bows, one and two-handed axes, staves and thrown weapons.~~Archibald, the undead weapon master in the War Quarter of the Undercity, can train the use of crossbows, daggers, one and two-handed swords and polearms.~
Death to Stormpike!
You have done an exceptional job, soldier! The cavalry is ready to ride on your command.
Awaiting orders from my superiors.
I suppose you are here to be trained in the use of a new weapon?  Make it fast, I'm very busy!

Sayoc is the orc weapon master.  He is located in Orgrimmar's Valley of Honor.  He can train the use of bows, daggers, fist weapons, one and two-handed axes and thrown weapons.~~Hanashi, the troll weapon master in the Valley of Honor of Orgrimmar, can instruct in the use of bows, one and two-handed axes, staves and all thrown weapons.~~Ansekhwa, the tauren weapon master, is on Thunder Bluff's lower rise.  He teaches the use of one and two-handed maces, staves and guns.~

$n, it's good to see veterans like you in the field!  I'm sorry to report that our supplies are currently too low to launch any large ground assaults against the Horde.$B$BSpeak with our quartermaster; he has supply missions available.
Have you come seeking training in the ways of armed combat?

Buliwyf, the dwarven weapon master at the Timberline Arms in Ironforge, teaches fist weapons, guns, one and two-handed axes and one and two-handed maces.~~Bixi Wobblebonk, the gnome weapon master at the Timberline Arms in Ironforge, teaches crossbow, daggers and throwing weapons.~~Ilyenia Moonfire, the night elf weapon master, resides at the Warrior's Terrace in Darnassus where she teaches bow, daggers, fist weapons, staff and throwing weapons.

FemaleText: The grace with which I fight is not something I can teach you, but I can teach you the use of various weapons.

Buliwyf, the dwarven weapon master at the Timberline Arms in Ironforge, teaches fist weapons, guns, one and two-handed axes and one and two-handed maces.~~Bixi Wobblebonk, the gnome weapon master at the Timberline Arms in Ironforge, teaches crossbow, daggers and throwing weapons.~~Woo Ping, the human weapon master at Weller's Arsenal in Stormwind, teaches crossbow, daggers, one and two-handed swords, polearms, and staff.

MaleText: Ye want to be trained in the use of a weapon, do ye?  Well don't stand there slack-jawed, speak up $gladdie : lassie;!

Bixi Wobblebonk, the gnome weapon master, is wandering about in this shop.  She can teach crossbow, daggers and throwing weapons.~~Woo Ping, the human weapon master at Weller's Arsenal in Stormwind, teaches crossbow, daggers, one and two-handed swords, polearms, and staff.~~Ilyenia Moonfire, the night elf weapon master, resides at the Warrior's Terrace in Darnassus where she teaches bow, daggers, fist weapons, staff and throwing weapons.

FemaleText: Well hi there!  Are you here to learn the proper technique of a new weapon?

Buliwyf, the dwarven weapon master right here at the Timberline Arms, teaches fist weapons, guns, one and two-handed axes and one and two-handed maces.~~Woo Ping, the human weapon master at Weller's Arsenal in Stormwind, teaches crossbow, daggers, one and two-handed swords, polearms, and staff.~~Ilyenia Moonfire, the night elf weapon master, resides at the Warrior's Terrace in Darnassus where she teaches bow, daggers, fist weapons, staff and throwing weapons.

MaleText: Death to Frostwolf!

FemaleText: The indigenous rams of Alterac are vital to the functionality of our cavalry!
Just a few more and our stables will be overflowing with mounts. Release it into my custody, soldier. I'll take it from here.

MaleText: Well met, $n. We must be brief because there is much to do.

May Cenarius guide you, $c.$B$BI am here in this corrupt land with my sisters on a mission of great importance to the Cenarian Circle. But only those who are powerful enough I ask speak to me about such matters--to send a lesser being would be folly.

FemaleText: My sisters and I have come down from the Stonetalon Mountains to put to rest a tragedy from ages past. Unfortunately, we are not powerful enough to accomplish our goals on our own and now seek mortals such as yourself to aid us.$B$BIf you are powerful enough, then we have much to discuss, $c. If you are not, then, for your safety, I will leave the details of my mission out of our conversation.

MaleText: I greet you, $r.

I need no home to know I still have a place in this world, $c. The tribes will see... all of them. They fight amongst one another, and for what? Scraps left over by vultures... lands infested by the Legion... bah!$B$BThe centaur should be proud of their heritage--it is just as noble as any Night elf's or orc's--it is time we started acting like it!
At last, I am free of the corruption that once bound me to this place...
Thank you for what you have done, $n.$B$BKeep the scepter safe; may it aid you in your toil against the evils that have invaded this place...

My scepter... After so many years... You have recovered it! You shall truly be the savior of this place...$B$BPlease listen to me carefully, $n. The head and the rod of the scepter may only be reunited into one at the Stone of Maraudon.
Between the colors, a path.$B$BBlink across in light.$B$BFrom the water, you emerge.
Between the orange and the purple passageways near the doors to Maraudon, you will find a third path.$B$BThe scepter you hold in your hands is the key.

I grow weary...$B$BFrom here, you can see the waterfalls, $n...The scepter grants you the power to travel to this very place, should you ever desire to enter through the front gates of Maraudon again.$B$BNear the entrance to Maraudon, you will find a passage that goes down beneath the caverns. Use the scepter at the ancient ritual site to create a portal, and you will find yourself here once more.

Long ago, my dryad sisters and I entered these caves to free the tortured spirit of my uncle, Zaetar. However, the corruption that had already spread through these caverns soon overcame us, and we too fell.$B$BWe were destined to wander these passages; the toxins poisoning our minds...$B$BAlthough my spirit may now be at rest, I know that I have failed in my mission. It is a great sadness I must bear...

Ah, Zaetar... <Celebras looks away.>$B$BMy father, Remulos, tried to stop him...$B$BZaetar was headstrong, and when he fell for an earthen elemental princess, my father knew that their union was cursed, but Zaetar refused to listen.$B$BThe centaur are the result of his mistake. They were born misshapen and hateful; my uncle Zaetar was killed by his own kin...$B$BThe evil princess, Theradras, still guards his remains here in the crystal caverns.
Welcome to the Explorer's League.  If you need information, and it is in book form, then I might be able to help you out.

As the toxins lurking within Maraudon seeped into my mind, I began to lose my grip on reality. Worried that it would be used for evil, my dryad sisters secretly took the scepter from me, breaking it into two parts and hiding it within the caverns.$B$BSoon they fell victim to the madness as well, and the two parts of the scepter, left unguarded, came to be in the possession of Vyletongue, himself. The satyr entrusted one part to Noxxion, an evil elemental, and the other he still has to this day.

Without knowledge of the incantations required to unite the two parts, Lord Vyletongue was unable to use the scepter. However, now that I am free of the curse of Vyletongue's corruption, I will be able to assist you, if you'd like to bring me the two parts -- both the head and the rod of the scepter.

You ask of the Sons of Cenarius, Remulos and Zaetar.$B$BMy father, Remulos, was strong and beautiful, and my uncle, Zaetar, very cunning and slight of build. While they were respected quite equally, Zaetar always felt as if he could never quite compare to the glory and attention he thought Remulos had.$B$BAfter my sisters and I were born, Zaetar, blinded by jealousy, set out to outdo his brother... He was the creator of his own end. The sadness it brings me has never lessened, even as time passes...
Greetings, $n. I am Doctor Gregory Victor, head trauma surgeon of Horde Trauma.

It is good to see you again, Doctor $n. I have been following your progress and I dare say that it is time you learned some of the more advanced bandaging techniques.$B$BReturn to me from time to time, as your skill advances, and I shall teach you all that I know.
Greetings, $n. I am Doctor Gustaf VanHowzen, head trauma surgeon of Alliance Trauma.

FemaleText: It's good to have veterans like you in Alterac Valley, $n.  Our supplies are too low to launch a ground assault through Alterac Valley... speak with our quartermaster - he'll tell you how to increase our supply base.

You!  $n!  What are you doing wandering around the village like this?  There are Alliance foes in Alterac!  We must drive them out!$B$BOur supplies are too low to launch a large ground assault, so speak with our quatermaster.  He'll tell you how you can increase our supply base.

MaleText: I am in charge of recruitment for the Frostwolf Clan. As a soldier of Frostwolf, it is your responsibility to check in with me as your rank among the clan rises.$B$BHonor and respect are earned on this frigid field.

Hail, $r! I am Lieutenant Haggerdin, officer in charge of recruitment for the Stormpike Guard.$B$BAs you gain prestige and notoriety among the Stormpike, return to me and I shall see about upgrading your insignia. Also, should you ever lose your insignia, I am able to supply a replacement.
Our ancestors teach us that while the individual must be strong, there is safety in numbers.  Do you wish to defend the honor of Thunder Bluff by organizing a guild?
Aye, you look the type to be a leader.  Here to organize a guild to fight for the Alliance?
Greetings, $c. I am Rexxar, champion of the Horde, servant of Thrall, master to the beasts of the wilds.

FemaleText: What is it you ask of the Blue Flight?

MaleText: Master Nesingwary has a big hunt ahead of him.  I find helping him prepare for a day in the jungle is much more relaxing than helping him ready for combat.  Although I do miss some of those glorious moments on the battlefield.

FemaleText: I know these forests as if they were a part of me... but know that there is still much to be learned from them, and much danger still hidden.

Yes, I expected that you would be back. I sent Korra out earlier and she came across Dartol's Rod, abandoned in the forest.$B$BWe worked so hard to recover it, $n. Please take care to see that you do not handle it so carelessly in the future.
You have completed Teronis' mission, and I appreciate all you have done, $n.

Hiya! This workshop isn't mine, no! But one day after I finish training I am going to be an inventor, just like my hero, Marvon Rivetseeker.$B$BYou've never heard of him? Well it just so happens that he left quite some time ago to study some ancient troll ruins he kept talking about. He left in a zeppelin... not quite sure about where exactly he went...$B$BTanarasin? Tenkeris? Taneranisany?$B$B<Liv shakes her head.>$B$BNo, that's not it...

Hi there. No, Marvon sure isn't here, and he won't be back for quite some time. Actually, I am getting a little worried about him...$B$BI hope he gets back soon. A large chest arrived for him and it's too heavy for me to lug it inside here! I had to leave it out by the door...

MaleText: You have learned all that I am able to teach you at this time, Doctor $n. Return to me when your practice has expanded and I shall train you in the ways of the more advanced medicinal arts.

FemaleText: This place... it's cursed.$B$BI barely managed to escape, and I cannot bear to go down through the tunnels again.$B$BMy brother, and sisters though... They were not as fortunate. Trapped inside, they are feverish with the corrupted haze that flows from the evil garden growing there.$B$BPlease, you must help.
Oh, I am so glad you have returned, $n.$B$BMy brother's spirit has now be freed from the corruption, but I choose to remain here, in my mourning.$B$BThank you so much for your help, $n.
Need some supplies?

MaleText: Awaiting orders, sir. On your command, I shall unleash hell upon them!
You have come to learn in the art of warfare, $r? You have come to the wrong place.
You have come to learn of battles won and lost on this field? There are no winners here...
Greetings, soldier. Intelligence has reported that the Winterax trolls to the west have taken a master goblin engineer prisoner. Perhaps you should investigate?
My scouts report that the Syndicate has taken up residence in a hidden cave on the eastern plateau. Be cautious when adventuring in that area.

Watch your step, soldier. The Stormpike have littered the ground around their bases with landmines. Speak with our explosives expert in the watch tower to the east if you want information on how to diffuse their mine fields.

Look alive, soldier! Stormpike Intelligence has reported that a master goblin engineer has been taken prisoner by the Winterax trolls. The Frostwolf dogs are actively trying to rescue him so that they may use his engineered gadgets to destroy us! Do not let that happen.
The Syndicate have been reported to be nosing around in a cave on the eastern plateau. Find out what they're up to, soldier! Beware of Frostwolf activity!

Beware of entering Frostwolf territory, soldier. The whole damn place is booby trapped! Landmines galore! Speak with our explosives expert in the first tower on the front lines for more information. I am certain that he could teach you how to diffuse the situation.
Helpless... powerless... restore... must restore... Zevrim controls... end this torment...

Thank you, mortal. There is but one service that I may offer to you before I return to the Dream.$B$BThe door to Zevrim's master, Alzzin, blocks your path. I shall act as your instrument of destruction. The door will be opened, I merely await your command.
We have barely any supplies.  If we want to send a ground assault into the Field of Strife, then we'll need a lot more!
We barely have any excess supplies.  It'll take a lot more work before we're ready to send another ground assault into the Field of Strife.
I almost have enough supplies to upgrade to veteran units.
I need many more supplies in order to upgrade our units.
I have about half the supplies needed to upgrade to veteran units.
I have less than one-third of the supplies needed to upgrade to veteran units.
Ugh... these pests keep me busy night and day! Haven't you seen them?$B$BI wish I could just jump down a pipe to get away from them...
Yes, $c?
I almost have enough supplies to upgrade to champion units.
I have about half the supplies needed to upgrade to champion units.
I barely have any supplies for upgrades.
I almost have enough supplies to upgrade our troops.
I need many more supplies in order to upgrade our units.
I almost have enough supplies to upgrade to veteran units.
I need many more supplies in order to upgrade our units.
I have about half the supplies needed to upgrade to veteran units.
I almost have enough supplies to upgrade to champion units.
I have about half the supplies needed to upgrade to champion units.
I barely have any supplies for upgrades.
Our units are not upgraded, and I don't have enough supplies to upgrade them.
Our units are upgraded to Seasoned, but I don't have enough supplies to upgrade them to Veteran.
Our units are upgraded to Veteran, but I don't have enough supplies to upgrade them to Champion.
I have enough supplies to upgrade  our troops to seasoned.
I have enough supplies to upgrade our troops to veterans.
I have enough supplies to upgrade our troops to champions.
I cannot store any more supplies.  I have all I can handle!
Your skill exceeds mine, though  I've heard that Old Man Heming in Booty Bay has copies of "The Bass and You".  That is sure to help you increase your skill.
FemaleText: Your skill exceeds mine, though  I've heard that Old Man Heming in Booty Bay has copies of "The Bass and You".  That is sure to help you increase your skill.

MaleText: Your skill exceeds mine, though  I've heard that Old Man Heming in Booty Bay has copies of "The Bass and You".  That is sure to help you increase your skill.
FemaleText: Your skill exceeds mine, though  I've heard that Old Man Heming in Booty Bay has copies of "The Bass and You".  That is sure to help you increase your skill.

MaleText: Please, please, please tell me you are here to get me out of these shackles.  There's got to be a key somewhere...$B$BAt the very least, maybe you can take out Guard Slip'kik.  I think I might be able to help you out!$B$BSee that broken trap over yonder?  The ogres are too stupid to figure out how to fix it.  Clearly, it needs a thorium widget and some frost oil.  If you fix it, I bet you could lure Slip'kik into it, and BLAMMO - trapped ogre guard!

There are two mines in Alterac: the Irondeep in Alliance territory and the Coldtooth mine in Horde territory.  Both mines are a rich source of minerals, and in the past were used to store excess supplies.$B$BNow, these mines are constantly fought over by the Horde, the Alliance and local denizens.
The towers and bunkers in Alterac Valley are vital strategic locales.  If we control a tower, then our troops can fire great distances from it.
Look to this ravaged field and know the power that the elements hold, $r.
The West Frostwolf Tower protects the gate between Frostwolf Village and Frostwolf Keep.$B$BIt is controlled by the Horde.
Captain Balinda Stonehearth has fallen!$B$BAttack the Horde!  Claim vengeance for Captain Stonehearth!
I know much, listen and be educated, $r.

In the time before time, what the usurpers would later call the First Age of Creation, my master and his siblings ruled over this world. It was they, the Old Gods, who created all.$B$BAnd it was they who would ultimately be cast down by those that would call themselves Shapers.~

Their manifest forms weak from eons of battle, imprisoned beneath the world - the world that they themselves created - the corruption of the Titan Shapers would permeate through the surface and befoul the Old Gods.$B$BIt was then and there that the brothers did turn. For five millennia a battle was fought at the core of this world.~
Both the Horde and Alliance captains have fallen!  Defeat Drek'Thar before it's too late!

Both the Horde and Alliance captains have taken to the field.  Our Captain Balinda Stonehearth directs the Stormpike forces from the Stonehearth Outpost, and the enemy Captain Galvangar barks orders from within Iceblood Garrison.$B$BTo battle!

Both the Horde and Alliance captains have taken to the field.  Our Captain Galvangar directs the Frostwolves from Iceblood Garrison, and his rival, Captain Balinda Stonehearth, hides in her Stonehearth Outpost.$B$BThe battle has begun!

Alterac Valley has been home to the Frostwolf Clan for years; we will not let the dwarves and their Alliance trespass!  And so we battle!$B$BTo win back Alterac, defeat their general Vanndar Stormpike, in Dun Baldar.$B$BFor the Horde!

The Stormpikes uncovered ancient artifacts within Alterac Valley, but the Frostwolf orcs don't take kindly to explorers.  If the dwarves have to fight for knowledge of their ancestors, then so be it!$B$BTo win this battle, defeat the orc, Drek'Thar, in Frostwolf Keep.  Fortune be with you, $c!

Captain Balinda Stonehearth leads the front line Alliance forces.  She is based in the Stonehearth Outpost, in the northern section of the Field of Strife.$B$BBalinda is currently in Stonehearth Outpost.
Captain Balinda Stonehearth leads the front line Alliance forces.  She is based in the Stonehearth Outpost, in the northern section of the Field of Strife.$B$BBalinda has been slain.
Drek'Thar is the military and spiritual leader of the Frostwolf Clan in Alterac, leading his brethren from Frostwolf Keep.$B$BIf he is defeated then the Horde forces in Alterac will crumble.

Captain Galvangar is the trusted aid to Drek'Thar.  He leads the Horde forces from the Iceblood Garrison, in the southern section of the the Field of Strife.$B$BCaptain Galvangar is currently in the Iceblood Garrison.
Vanndar Stormpike is the general of the Alliance military in Alterac, and directs his forces from Dun Baldar.$B$BIf he is defeated then the Alliance will surely lose the battle for Alterac.

It was during the Elemental Sundering that the Firelord, Ragnaros, would seek to consume my Lord, Thunderaan, Prince of Air.$B$B<Demitrian bows his head, his face contorted in rage.>$B$BSpeak his name and I shall decorate this ravaged camp with your entrails. Be silent and listen.~
It was the Lieutenants of Ragnaros, Geddon and Garr, who would perpetrate the betrayal against my Lord. Thunderaan was caught unaware.

The Firelord's advances were wholly unknown to Thunderaan. Before my Lord could react, Sulfuras, legendary hammer of Ragnaros, would strike an unmerciful blow. Thunderaan fell, utterly defeated.$B$BThe Firelord feasted upon the essence of my Lord, but was unable to consume him entirely.
What little remained of Thunderaan's essence was stored within a talisman of elemental binding. Ragnaros then shattered the talisman in two flawless pieces. The pieces assigned to his Lieutenants...~
You found a key?  Well, is it THE key?  I mean, is it the key to unlock these shackles?  Well $G sir : ma'am;, there is only one way to find out!
You big boss now!  You king!  All hail King $n, King of Gordok!$B$BNow that you da boss, all henchmen will give you tribute!  You left some alive, yeah boss?
Do you want to play a game, stinky?
I hold the key to lands of free! Chase me and you'll see!
Still alive? You do surprise. Watch me as I flee!
Turn that frown upside down!
This is the end of the line, no friend of mine!

All henchmen of da boss - Stomper Kreeg, all three of da Guards, Captain Kromcrush, and da Observer - give tribute to da new boss.  If you kill a henchman, then that henchman can't give tribute!  Each one you keep alive will give you more tribute.  Keep all of them alive and you get da BIG tribute!$B$BYeah!

Well, from what I've gathered while waiting to be eaten by these yokels... it might not be necessary to kill every ogre you find here.$B$BThe ogres were going on and on the other day about how King Gordok came to power; specifically, he killed the previous king and took his place.  Well, the king's henchmen - those that Gordok spared - immediately swore fealty to the new king.$B$BWho knows - the ogre you save could very well be your own... figuratively speaking, of course!
You da boss now, yeah?  Long live da new king!$B$BKreeg let you look at Gordok hooch.  Ogre hooch best of all hooch, and Gordok hooch best of all ogre hooch!  Maybe you buy some from me, ya boss?!
OK boss, when you ready for da tribue from your henchmen, you let me know!

FemaleText: Leave this place, stranger, lest it consume you as it has all that it has touched.
Do you know of the Highborne? The Shen'dralar?

The Shen'dralar were Queen Azshara's most revered arcanists. It was within these very walls that the Queen's most important demands were processed - often in secret.$B$BAfter the destruction of the Well and the subsequent lethargy that overcame the Highborne and lesser night elf sects, the Prince of Eldre'Thalas, Tortheldrin, began construction of the pylons that you see littering the halls of the west wing.~

The Prince plotted to imprison a demon of immense power behind a grand force field. The pylons would channel latent energies into the field, keeping it operational.$B$BWhile imprisoned, Immol'thar would serve as a battery to the populace of Eldre'Thalas.

The siphoned energies would sustain the Highborne's magic, allowing those within the walls of Eldre'Thalas to feed their endless and growing magical pangs.$B$BThousands of years passed and the power required to keep Immol'thar imprisoned while sustaining life within Eldre'Thalas, began to shift. The cost to keep Immol'thar bound grew to overshadow the rate at which energy could be siphoned and distributed. The once net gain turned to loss.
The Highborne ghosts that you see wandering through the courtyard and halls of Eldre'Thalas were slain, not by invading Gordok ogres or satyrs, but by the Prince himself!

The people were destroyed in order to preserve the Prince's immortal life and near limitless powers. The power once divided among thousands now funnels into the Prince and the Shen'dralar zealots. Those few remaining survivors are directly feeding power into the pylons in order to keep Immol'thar imprisoned.$B$BShould the demon break free of its bonds, it would surely destroy what little is left of this once great bastion of arcana.

MaleText: You da man now, dog!
Fengus make you fierce!  Crazed!  RAR!
You got me good boss!  How you get by Slip'kik??  I smart though, I watch next time!  Har har!$B$BNobody get by Slip'kik no more. Slip'kik promise!
I show you how smart I am, boss!  You be extra smart with mighty magic mojo now!$B$BUm... maybe Slip'kik use magic on self. Dat would be good idea...
You are da king of the Gordok!  You're A-number-one!
I heard you was dead... well, you won't be easy to make dead after this!

For 10,000 years I have ruled this kingdom. In that time, I have heard many fascinating tales from those that would walk the hallowed grounds of the House of Shen'dralar.$B$BAs I am bound to this place, I often exchange stories with visitors. Do you have a story for me or perhaps you would like to hear a story?
We mustn't anger the Master. His is a wrath that is cruel beyond measure.
FemaleText: We mustn't anger the Master. His is a wrath that is cruel beyond measure.

MaleText: Keep your voice down, stranger. You do not want to disrupt the Master's meditations.
FemaleText: Keep your voice down, stranger. You do not want to disrupt the Master's meditations.

MaleText: Many have come to this sanctuary, few have left.
FemaleText: Many have come to this sanctuary, few have left.

MaleText: The Lorekeeper is an ancient. He has served under our glorious Queen!
FemaleText: The Lorekeeper is an ancient. He has served under our glorious Queen!

MaleText: What you doin' wanderin' around here?  Why them small fries not in da shackles?!
You da strong one now!  All hail to da new king of da Gordok!
Do I see them with weapons still?  Why you let them keep their weapons?!
Um, you kill king, yeah?  That means you take his place.  That make you da new boss!  Hail to da king!

FemaleText: Oh the horror! The tragedy! We are on the verge of a breakthrough, yet all could be lost.

MaleText: Uh... I sorry I attack you boss.  You no kill me, please OK!?  You da king now, and I help make your tribute better!
A cursory examination of the skeletal remains indicates that the flesh was seared off. Quite a grisly sight.
Maybe you do better at getting back prized Gordok relic from creepy Highborne prince than da old boss did!
Hail to da new king!
When I scowled at you before you became da new king... um... I was just joking.$B$BYeah!
Dem other ogres was dumb to attack you, boss!  Dat's why I'm still alive - I'm smart and stuff!
We a lot cleaner than da ogres in Tanaris.  All over da desert as far as da eye can see - ogre poo.  Not here, no $g sir : ma'am;!
So long as you stay here with us, you da king.  You take off, and some other ogre will take your place.  That's da way of da Gordok!
I am so smart!  S-M-R-T!
Old king got dead?  That's unpossible!
I cause you no trouble, boss.
Books have been disappearing as of late. The Lorekeeper and his assistants are in a frenzy. They suspect foul play within Eldre'Thalas.
FemaleText: Books have been disappearing as of late. The Lorekeeper and his assistants are in a frenzy. They suspect foul play within Eldre'Thalas.

MaleText: Has the Prince recanted the tale of the Ashbringer? It is our most favorite of his stories. His favorite is the followup to the Ashbringer. Of course, nobody has ever been able to get that story out of him.
FemaleText: Has the Prince recanted the tale of the Ashbringer? It is our most favorite of his stories. His favorite is the followup to the Ashbringer. Of course, nobody has ever been able to get that story out of him.

MaleText: I suspect that the imps are stealing knowledge.
FemaleText: I suspect that the imps are stealing knowledge.

MaleText: The Master holds great interest in the lair of Nefarian. If only someone would defeat the dragon and his minions and retell the tale to the Prince. I bet that would loosen the Prince's lips. The Ashbringer could be found!
FemaleText: The Master holds great interest in the lair of Nefarian. If only someone would defeat the dragon and his minions and retell the tale to the Prince. I bet that would loosen the Prince's lips. The Ashbringer could be found!

MaleText: If you not talk to Mizzle, you not become da king!  Take to Mizzle da Crafty!

So... you took out the King eh?  I knew that these bozos would make you the new king, I just knew it!  That's all these bozos understand - power.$B$BIt would seem that the more henchmen you keep alive, the higher your tribute will be.  Not to shabby - makes for an interesting challenge I'd say.  If you leave, I wouldn't expect to remain king.  One of these yokels will no doubt step up and take your place.$B$BOne more thing... you didn't happen to find my key, did you?
What you must understand is that being able to index 10,000 years of existence has given me a rather unique perspective on life. Your present day trials and tribulations are meaningless.

Oh the drama and fuss the young Master exerted. You would think the fate of the world rested squarely on his shoulders. Only mortals could have such a skewed perspective on our world.$B$BAlas, he left me with his meager magical secrets... Librams or some such nonsense. I have no use for these paultry magics but perhaps you might be interested in their enchantments.
They've been stolen, $r! Three of our most prized volumes. Should you return the tomes, a reward will most certainly be yours.
<You cannot comprehend any of the technical mumbo jumbo on this scroll.>
<The complicated schematics are too much for your meager engineering talents to discern.>
The fabric of which our world is woven is most delicate. It merely takes some knowledge and the application of said knowledge to tear the fabric. It is thusly that rifts are born.
I am he that carries out the Warchief's commands without question. I am Horde.
I live only to serve our King.
Perhaps one day, your contributions to the Alliance will be as great as the heroes you have seen this day. Honor them, $n.
10,000 years of recorded knowledge tends to draw the wrong element to the Athenaeum. Books are stolen, recovered and stolen again on a daily basis.

FemaleText: Kildrath tends to overdramatize the situation. For example, "Garona: A Study on Stealth and Treachery," has been stolen over 400 times.$B$BThe mark of the Athenaeum protects the tomes, preventing any unauthorized viewings.

MaleText: <Lydros reaches into his robe and presents you with a dull, flat elven blade.>$B$BIn ages past, well before even the War of the Ancients, there existed this blade.

The blade itself had to be crafted in ceremony with the children of the Aspects. A rare occurrence indeed... For not only would a dragon have to willingly heat and mold the enchanted metal with their breath, they would also need to contain the fury of their own enchantment by using their blood as temper.~

Over the course of 8,000 years, only a handful of these blades were created - each blade unique in both power and appearance. The blades of Quel'Serrar would take on the characteristics of their creator.

Rumors exist of a single, legendary blade of Quel'Serrar crafted for an unknown entity by the combined might of the five Aspects. Before the abominations of Nefarian and Deathwing were thrust into our world, such meetings of the Aspect were represented by the term 'Prismatic.' I could only assume that the Prismatic Blade of Quel'Serrar was a most glorious creation.~

What I offer to you now is one such blade, unfired, unheated, untreated - the most raw and basic form.$B$BNow you merely need to find a dragon that will willingly enchant the blade.$B$BIf you had an eternity to live, this might be a possibility; but since you are mortal and could very likely cease to exist at any moment, might I recommend trying to persuade one of the lesser dragons to do your bidding.
Have you heard of the brood mother of the Black Flight? I believe she is called Onyxia...
I have no time for interruptions.
Can I help you?

Aye, but I know it by its true name - Eldre'Thalas.  It was a bastion of magical power for the night elves many, many years ago.$B$BYou know of Eldre'Thalas, young one?  One might say that is coincidental to my current plight... but I am one not to believe in coincidence.

Agents of the Cenarion Circle have uncovered disturbing information pertaining to the current situation in Eldre'Thalas.  I am at an impasse as to what to do about it, and I will no doubt soon seek the aid of able bodied beings capable of handling themselves in a fight.$B$BTo properly take action in Eldre'Thalas, however, is to understand the lore of an object known as the Fruit of Fertility.

In ages past, Eldre'Thalas was a nexus of magical power, and those who dwelt within its hallowed halls wielded immense power.  One such night elf was Millicent Serene - a naturalist who willed the power of nature itself into potent artifacts she forged.$B$BThe Fruit of Fertility was her crowning achievement... she used a specially prepared moonwell to grow an exotic and vibrant vine that was imbued with an aura of protection and growth.  All of Eldre'Thalas flourished from its existence.

Alas, it always seems like it does.  I - as did the rest of the Cenarion Circle - had assumed that Milli's creation was destroyed during the War of the Ancients.  This, as I have come to learn, is far from correct.$B$BThe Fruit of Fertility survived... though now it is known as the Felvine.  It is being corrupted by the demonic lord of that section of Eldre'Thalas, Alzzin the Wildshaper.

I... cannot begin to imagine, $n.  All I know is that I am not going to allow it to happen.  It will be destroyed - if not for our continued safety from demonic taint, then for the memory of Millicent Serene... Milli...$B$BThis, my friend, this is where I hope you will come in.
Greetings and salutations, hero!  I have the latest news from both continents and points beyond for your consideration.
FemaleText: Greetings and salutations, hero!  I have the latest news from both continents and points beyond for your consideration.

MaleText: You will need to find Nat Pagle in Dustwallow Marsh to get any better than you are currently.
FemaleText: You will need to find Nat Pagle in Dustwallow Marsh to get any better than you are currently.

MaleText: You will need to find Nat Pagle in Dustwallow Marsh to get any better than you are currently.
FemaleText: You will need to find Nat Pagle in Dustwallow Marsh to get any better than you are currently.

MaleText: I can teach you fishing skills.
FemaleText: I can teach you fishing skills.

MaleText: The waters of northern Sar'theris Strand in Desolace or the Angor Fortress in Badlands have locked boxes that can be picked open.
FemaleText: The waters of northern Sar'theris Strand in Desolace or the Angor Fortress in Badlands have locked boxes that can be picked open.

MaleText: The Pool of Tears in the Swamp of Sorrows holds ancient locked boxes that were lost in another age.
FemaleText: The Pool of Tears in the Swamp of Sorrows holds ancient locked boxes that were lost in another age.

MaleText: Both Lost Rigger Cove in Tanaris and the Bay of Storms in Azshara have boxes that can be picked to improve your skill.
FemaleText: Both Lost Rigger Cove in Tanaris and the Bay of Storms in Azshara have boxes that can be picked to improve your skill.

MaleText: The Scarlet Crusade of Tyr's Hand in the Eastern Plaguelands have many lockboxes that will challenge your skill.
FemaleText: The Scarlet Crusade of Tyr's Hand in the Eastern Plaguelands have many lockboxes that will challenge your skill.

MaleText: Many locked boxes of supplies were sunk by the orcs in Lake Everstill in Redridge.
FemaleText: Many locked boxes of supplies were sunk by the orcs in Lake Everstill in Redridge.

MaleText: Many locked supply boxes were lost when the Naga overran the Zoram Strand in Ashenvale.
FemaleText: Many locked supply boxes were lost when the Naga overran the Zoram Strand in Ashenvale.

MaleText: The Venture Company based around Windshear Crag in Stonetalon keeps their supplies in locked boxes.
FemaleText: The Venture Company based around Windshear Crag in Stonetalon keeps their supplies in locked boxes.

MaleText: The Syndicate keeps many locked boxes of supplies in Durnholde Keep in Hillsbrad.
FemaleText: The Syndicate keeps many locked boxes of supplies in Durnholde Keep in Hillsbrad.

MaleText: I study the known and unknown elements of our world.
There comes a time when the life we know falls short.  We are trapped and look for answers, and we find hope burning in dark places.$B$BOnly then, $n, do we take our first steps to freedom.
Do you have any spiders or beetles, $c?  They scurry fast, but if you're faster then you'll find them quite a treat!
You are certainly a long way from home, $r.
So, you have found me. I suppose that you have come to learn of suppression and control.$B$BI will teach you much more than that... you will also learn of sacrifice.$B$B<Daio grins.>
That will be the choice of the demon you wish to conjure and enslave. We wield dark powers and we pay grossly for the use of said powers.
We must first craft a prison to confine the beast, if you wish to progress further.
Bow in my presence, insect! Surely you can feel the power I hold over you.

So you have come to Niby to learn the secrets of calling down an infernal servant from the Nether.$B$BSilence! Niby knows all!$B$BNiby is not so quick to part with such knowledge. First, you must assist Niby with a very important task.

There is a powerful infernal named Kroshius northeast of this camp. It is why Niby is here. Kroshius is a greater infernal - an infernal that has lasted longer than expected. You see, nub, an infernal crashes down into the earth with great intensity to serve its master but this intensity fades fast. Once the blazing flames have died down, the infernal crumbles.

Do not interrupt Niby, fool! I shall rend the flesh from your bones and use your skeletal remains as a coat rack. Now where was I? Oh yes, so, Kroshius lasted nearly ten times longer than any ordinary infernal. I am not sure why but I am confident that with enough study, I could find out.$B$BI need you to recover Kroshius' Infernal Core.

If I am to teach you the secrets of summoning an infernal servant, you must destroy Kroshius and bring me the infernal core from his burning remains. This, however, is not as easy as it sounds. Kroshius has all but burned out completely. You must reignite his corpse and raise him from the rubble. To do this, however, you must gather some components from other demonic entities.$B$BMy imp, Impsy, shall set you on your way.

FemaleText: There are costs with war, $c... ones often overlooked.  Those costs are the orphans - children who have lost their parents to the far-too-numerous conflicts that rage across Azeroth.  Those children who have no one else to turn to often come here to live until they are old enough to fend for themselves.$B$BOne week out of the year during the Spring, the Horde takes time to give something back to these innocents.  This time is called Children's Week.~

There are costs with war, $c... ones often overlooked.  Those costs are the orphans - children who have lost their parents to the far-too-numerous conflicts that rage across Azeroth.  Those children who have no one else to turn to often come here to live until they are old enough to fend for themselves.$B$BOne week out of the year during the Spring, the Alliance takes time to give something back to these innocents.  This time is called Children's Week.~

MaleText: Greetings young one, and welcome to Thunder Bluff.  You'll find safe refuge from the burdens of the world here.  All denizens of the Horde are welcome here.$B$BThe spirits of the present and past come alive here in this sacred place, my friend.  Honor them, and in doing so honor yourself.
Seek out Shandrina in Silverwind Refuge.  She can sell you the "Expert Cookbook".
FemaleText: Seek out Shandrina in Silverwind Refuge.  She can sell you the "Expert Cookbook".

MaleText: Cooking is a life long pursuit and I see we share the same passion!
FemaleText: Cooking is a life long pursuit and I see we share the same passion!

MaleText: Dirge Quikcleave of Gadgetzan is a master of the culinary arts.  To better yourself you will need to seek him out.
FemaleText: Dirge Quikcleave of Gadgetzan is a master of the culinary arts.  To better yourself you will need to seek him out.

MaleText: Wulan in Shadowprey Village can sell you the "Expert Cookbook".  You will need that if you are to better yourself.
FemaleText: Wulan in Shadowprey Village can sell you the "Expert Cookbook".  You will need that if you are to better yourself.

MaleText: I can teach you how to cook!
FemaleText: I can teach you how to cook!
